Reviews.Title: “In a league of its own”
Reviews.Author: pdmco
Reviews.Content: This outstanding hotel oozes style from the moment you see it and it just gets better as you enter the reception area and your room. The real plus is that on top of this the staff are friendly, professional and very helpful. It may not be in the centre of Madrid but we found that a bonus as it's minutes from the nearest metro station, an easy trip to the centre and airport, and also situated in a pleasant neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “One of the coolest hotels I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Carlos_G
Reviews.Content: the moment you approach the hotel you think to yourself "How cool is that!?" checking in process with the help of an iPad showing you the available floors (ALL different, ALL made by different designers). The rooms are extremely well thought and the restaurants, bars are superb (Especially Lagrimas Negras, that reminds me of Bebo & Cigala music). Another highlight is the roof top bar with an amazing view of the city. Very well located, 20 min from Barajas, 10 min from downtown Madrid, this hotel is something you must visit when in Madriz

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: identical105
Reviews.Content: We just completed a one week stay at the Puerta America. My family and I had a wonderful time at this facility. The breakfast buffet is superb and the staff are simply extraordinary. We were very fortunate that Arancha catered to our every need during breakfast. Moreover, our room on the Mark Newsome floor, provided a welcome respite from our daily travels throughout the beautiful city of Madrid. For this American, who has been dependent on an automobile for my entire adult life, the simplicity and timeliness of the Madrid Metro made this trip a truly extraordinary experience. I eagerly anticipated my daily walk to the conveniently located Cartagena Metro station. After just one stop, you had access to three other lines at the Avenida de America station. From there, it is mere minutes to every significant neighborhood in Madrid. I only wish that my home Subway, the great New York system, was operated as efficiently as the Madrid Metro. In conclusion, you will be pleased that you chose the Silken Puerta for your stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “So you can drive a Ferrari or a Porsche”
Reviews.Author: JosePilly
Reviews.Content: It was a surprise to be hosted at this amazing hotel. I visit the hotel web page before I arrived from Nairobi, but the real surprise was at arrival when I saw a Ferrari and a Porsche at the door ready to be driven if you wish. Of course they were for rent. The personnel immediately take your luggage and take you to the reception. After that the tour of you room is done and explained, because it needs explanation! My goodness everything goes electronic... and very comfortable. There was only a thing that wasn't good at all, the design of the basin to wash your hands. The water was splashing all over every time I was opening. No problem, the room service was very good. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wow..........FIVE stars!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tracya1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first wedding anniversary in April 2012....its fantastic!!! Each floor is designed by a different designer and I wanted the Kathryn Finlay Floor (Floor 8).....we'd heard and seen bout the floor on the hotels own website and by chance when we checked in we WERE on Floor 8!!! The rooms are lovely and bright, with pure white fixtures and fittings, electonically controlled windows and a tv that come down from the ceiling!!! Oh, and a huge bath big enough for two. Each floor has a different theme, and when you stop on each floor in the lift, it opens to show you a different designer piece of art, which is brilliant!!! The service is excellent, we had told them it was our anniversary, and we were given free wine in MAD Restaurant on the day with our meal, which was beautiful (my husband said it was the best pork he had ever tasted!!). Both the bars are lovely too, Skylight on the 13th Floor looks out over the city.....but be warned, drinks aren't cheap......£12 a cocktail. A huge plus for this hotel is that it is literally a 5 minute walk to the nearest Metro station (Cartagena), and from here you can get to the tourist sites and city centre bars and restaurants in a few stops, so the price of the drinks etc. isn't a massive deal if you are willing to travel out and explore.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel @ its best”
Reviews.Author: Chris11271
Reviews.Content: Great designer hotel. Fixtures and fittings are top notch, staff extremely friendly and fabulous breakfast. Cocktail bar on ground floor good although could do with losing naff lounge music but still well worth the a visit. Only a slight grumble, it is a little bit out of town although metro close by. Don,t let that put you off, this hotel is the best I have stayed in when visiting Madrid. Will defo go back.

Reviews.Title: “FASCINATING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: F M
Reviews.Content: I was recently lodged in Hotel Silen "Puerta de America" in MAdrid. The Hotel is fascinating. Each floor was designed by different arquitechs, fashion-people. Nonetheless, the most exciting for me was breakfast. Just, yummi and huge range of options. Only handicap was that my room had a proyector and screen in bed, which was superb but you could not rent a movie to watch it on te screen.

Reviews.Title: “Design trumps practicality”
Reviews.Author: cillierabbit
Reviews.Content: The location is not good if you're a tourist, as it's a half-hour subway ride with a couple changes to get to the city center. We were there for a meeting, so the location was bearable, and it's about a 20 min walk or short cab ride to Calle Serrano, which has some great restaurants and shopping. I didn't like the rooms in this hotel at all. Over a 3-week period, I stayed in rooms on the 8th, 9th and 10th floors. Overall what annoys me about this hotel is that design trumps practicality. A common theme of rooms on all three floors I tried: very little space to store clothes. Yeah I had a lot for a 3-week trip, but I can't imagine sharing the space with another person even when packing more lightly. The 10th floor is almost all black -- even if this doesn't depress you, the shower will, as it's designed so that water will spray all over the bathroom floor. Also unless you reach the shower through the bathtub, you'll get blasted with cold water when turning the water on. The 9th floor was the "best" of the ones I stayed on. The only annoying impracticality was the bathroom faucet had only a temperature control. So the water was either off or on full blast, which I think would be annoying if sharing the room and using the bathroom in the middle of the night. The 8th floor is all white and arguably the least practically designed of all. There's a dearth of towel racks, so to have a towel nearby the centrally located bathtub/shower, you need to rest the towel on the cramped sink area. The bath/shower itself is a disaster, as the design guarantees that with the slightest draft, the shower curtain will envelop your body -- all I could think about what how nasty this must be, with all the previous guests. The worst though is that whatever materials were used to build this floor, they amplify sound to the point that you can hear EVERYTHING from the hallway. The first night I literally thought I forgot to close my door, the sounds were so clear. Except for the 10th floor, the other rooms I stayed in had very minimal desk space, so forget about really working in your room. While wireless is free at this hotel, it's also very slow and unreliable. In my room on the 9th floor, it barely worked at all. The worst though is that every time you log in, a username and password must be entered. And it's a ridiculous password, like "9DdfX4ga", which is fun to type on a smartphone. Then there's the annoyance of having this log in only valid for three days, after which you have to remember to ask the front desk for another code. Special damnation is reserved for the gym. This is easily the worst gym I've ever experienced in my life. Why even bother having one? Once again design trumps practicality, as it's all black and almost completely dark, with glass walls. The first time there I was paranoid about walking into a wall as my eyes were adjusting to the light. I understand in Europe gyms are small and less highly prized, but there's no need to make a gym look like a nightclub. Also the temperature control didn't seem to work, so in combination from the humidity (and chlorine scent from the adjacent pool), I almost felt like collapsing after 30 minutes on the elliptical, despite being in decent shape. The service at the hotel is average and the sandwiches in the lobby bar are good for a quick dinner. Overall though, the impractical design of this hotel is a huge turnoff for me. Maybe for a quick weekend trip this is ok, but for three weeks it's uncomfortable to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark design hotel, welcoming and modern”
Reviews.Author: Alex S
Reviews.Content: The Silken Puerta America is a superbly designed, welcoming hotel. The design influence brings beauty to every floor - I ended up riding up and down the lift to check out all the different floors. The service is good and dining options reasonable. The breakfast is outstandingly good. Room was clean and well laid out, beautifully designed and very trendy. Overall, strongly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Pillab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Puerta America Hotel in Madrid and switched rooms so that we could experience the different designs in the rooms on each floor. We had checked out and reserved in advance a room on the floor that we liked, only to find out after checking out of our room that it was not available anymore. They sent us to a smoking room without asking, we are not smokers! They then sent us to a room where everything was black, black walls, black furniture, black bathroom, black toilet paper... We did not like the room and switched the next day. What we did't realize with everything black is that a few of our belongings including our passports had been left behind. We called the front desk to let them know and begged to please help us. They pretended to be helping, but they didn't. They assured us that the maids do a thorough check and nothing was left behind. We went straight to the old room, asked the cleaning lady to please check the rom for us, and sure enough, our passports were there. Therest of our belongings, we never got back, but at least we were able to make it back home.

Reviews.Title: “A-MAY-ZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: rubiabuena
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with some girlfriends for a Spanish language practice break and we had a fantastic time. The hotel was in a great location enabling us to see some of the city as we walked to the centre, although there is a metro right outside the hotel. The staff were extremely helpful, on arrival you get to pick your room from a series of photos on an iPad, each floor is beautifully decorated by a different designer to a dramatic effect and the cocktail bar on the roof was fabulous, although a little pricey but hay we were in another country so it doesn't count!! The rooms were beautiful, beds were very comfy and the facilities themselves were very impressive. The view from our window was amazing and if you go up in the lift to look at all the other floors, like we did, it just gets better the higher you go. This hotel made us feel very welcome and special. I am planning on returning there again with my boyfriend for a long weekend very soon. Five stars just doesn't cover it I'm afraid!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay. STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GlenisterP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend from the 25th to the 27th. I read many reviews on here for this hotel and they are pretty accurate. The hotel is the "funkiest" hotel I have stayed in, Very clean and the staff are so friendly and helpful it really made our stay! On arrival we were early to check in but still given a choice of rooms, we could of waited for other rooms to be made ready but the room they had ready was perfect. The rooms are very clean and well equipped and are of high standard as you would expect from a 5* hotel. The breakfast was amazing and staff so helpful and friendly nothing was too much for them. I did have my doubts about being out of the centre but the metro is a 2 minute walk away and was cheap and easy to use so worth being out of the centre. If this hotel was in the centre they could charge twice as much or more. Will be going back to stay on a different floor. We were on the 6th floor very cool décor and rooms were spacious. We walked around the other floors and they were amazingly decorated to high standards. The 13th floor sky walk over the glass floor was cool all be it a bit scary for someone that has a slight height fobia :-) Well worth staying here. Paul and Emma

Reviews.Title: “So different, so good!”
Reviews.Author: chapeluser
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked this as a half term break. So spacious, so pretty - we really loved it. We had the Kathryn Findlay floor, the white floor, just beautiful. If I had to pick a downside it would simply be its location. It's not a particularly pretty area, but the hotel is about 20 yards from the Metro station, so how much does it matter? A word of financial caution.... I think the cheaper restaurant in the hotel is closed on Monday nights, so we went to the more expensive one. Apparently it's one of the best in Madrid and the level of service and presentation reflects this. Prices to match though, so take care! Would I go again? Am booking as we speak! Charming staff which always helps.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Swanky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobcat81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently. When we checked in at first we were a little disapointed as we were not shown a choice of floors to stay in but when requested to see it on the I pad we were shown them in a book and only 2 floors were available. We picked on room, cant recall which floor, possibly the 5th or 7th and when we got to the room, it was quite rundown with shabby ceilings covered in dirt and the room was not so great, it was a surprise how poor it was actually. My wife had booked the place for my 30th so she wanted it to be special. So we went down and enquired about a different room. This girl at reception was much friendlier and we got a room on 11th floor I think that was much much better. It was really nice room and big comfy bed as well as curtains to block out all light for sleeping on in the morning. The bath was huge, the whole room was excellent, really was. Apart from first little mix up everything was great here. Ok the pool on the top floor is pretty pathetic, i mean its like a big bath, its not great and maybe one could argue the place tries to be a bit too cool but its different and we both really liked it. The location is a little bit out of the centre would be another downfall but the underground service is so good that it really becomes a bit of a non issue. Ten mins on underground with one change and you are at Sol, the centre of the city really. The staff here are very friendly, one helped us with a map and gave us, in great detail, an indication of what to see and do. The bar men in the bar were very friendly and all staff really were very professional and very nice. We really enjoyed our stay! I didnt pay as I was being treated but my understanding (from what I could find out) is that it wasn't cheap and may be a little over priced for what it is!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel , highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: marceloch
Reviews.Content: great hotel and decor ... fantastic cost benefit for a 5 star hotel ... fantastic when back in madrid will return for sure

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cargenty
Reviews.Content: Each floor of the hotel is designed by a different architect. Each room has a unique concept. When we arrived they asked us to choose a room looking photos in an Ipad!. Hard to choose because each room has interesting things. The rooms are bigger than the European average. Big beds very comfortable and what I most liked is the sight and cleanliness throughout the hotel. The staff is young and very friendly. The hotel is not located in the center but the metro is at walking distance (2 minutes) and they have taxis on a 24 hour basis. Excellent restaurant and bar in the terrace with a spectacular view. The pool, coffee area, everything is perfect. I was able to make a tour of the hotel and have been even more delighted. I had never stayed in a hotel like this. I want to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Futuristic and modern”
Reviews.Author: smerfette
Reviews.Content: A very modern and futuristic hotel with a different theme on each floor. Room designs can be kind pf quirky, e.g. no bathroom doors with mirrors all around, so make sure you book accordingly. There's a nice roof deck bar with views Madrid. The only downside is that it's far from all the activities and sights. It can be quite the trek after a day of touring even with the nearby train stations. Wifi passwords are given upon request. Make sure you ask for a day pass or longer. Otherwise, they tend to hand out hourly passes.

Reviews.Title: “A Designer Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dkkam
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with very nice rooms. We stayed in the room with a round bed, round bath tub and a projector TV. Going to each floor to look around is definite a fun thing to do. When we checked in, we were told only one room was available, so we didn't get to choose. Reception staff can be more friendly in this 5 star hotel. As others have mentioned, it is a little out of the center, but the rate is relatively more reasonable than those at the city center. Great place to stay for 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Silken Puerta America”
Reviews.Author: amra74
Reviews.Content: A bit far from the city center, and the staff at the reception & bar could be more friendly, but very comfortable rooms and everything is of excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Business”
Reviews.Author: derekhannon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for only one night but it was excellent. It's very different to other hotels with each floor designed uniquely. The room was really modern, projector screen for TV, nice round bed and total blackout blind. Breakfast was really nice. the tea wasn't that great but not surprised as tea isn't as popular in Spain. Friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a business meeting....”
Reviews.Author: sallyjt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 10-13th January for a European Sales Meeting. Very, very comfortable - interesting rooms with different designer for each floor - only saw a couple of other rooms but mine on the 6th was fine. Intriguing folding partition that made the bathroom open plan if required though not sure when that would be used, however freindly you were with your room mate! I'm not sure how far it was out of the centre but looking out of the window I did feel that I could have been anywhere in UK/Europe - looked out on to apartment blocks and a dual carriageway. Amazing breakfasts, good buffet lunches provided as part of the conference. Very efficient and friendly staff. Def recommend for a business trip but maybe not for a personal trip as not close to the centre

Reviews.Title: “It was "ok"”
Reviews.Author: Peter030470
Reviews.Content: Nice enough place, staff very friendly and helpful. Room was "interesting". Views from the 11th floor are great. However, travelling with a business colleague we found the hotel had a double room booked for the pair of us - problem resolved efficiently though. Air conditioning in my room was noisy and I couldn't turn it off. Breakfast was not included in the room rate but I didn't find out until I turned up at the restaurant - not a big drama but 22€ was a bit steep for food that was extremely average. Overall it was OK - but I wouldn't go back for a pleasure break.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: IggyM
Reviews.Content: Cool hotel, friendly staff, definitely worth exploring each floor. Nice restaurant, good food and cool rooftop bar. Also the lounge bar had great atmosphere and served lovely cocktails. Swimming pool was good with a nice view and very quiet on Sunday morning. The location isn't great but it's worth staying just to check out the hotel. The closest underground station was couple of minutes walk away and journey to central Madrid around 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly different hotel to stay in.....very pricey bar though!”
Reviews.Author: Kent_Jode
Reviews.Content: We went and stayed at this hotel for three nights in January 2012. It was part of a deal with Lastminute.com and was amazed to find that we got it for the price we paid. The hotel itself looks stunning from the outside and looks like it should belong on a beach resort. The porters and reception staff are very friendly and keen to help and are not on your back for a tip for just pointing out the toilets like some hotels! The booking in at reception was nice and quick and we loved the fact that you get to flick through and chose the type of room you want. Due to us booking in quite late the options were limited but we stayed on the 6th floor and we was very happy with our room. The room had exactly what we needed and the views were lovely out onto the city. The top floor boasts a nice litlle swimming pool a sauna and a very cold turkish bath. It was nice to go up and chill out but not somewhere that appears to be used alot. The views from the 13th floor are lovely and the bar at night looks fab. We stayed away from it for most of the weekend as it seemed crowded but went up on the sunday night for a drink. Two spirits and mixers came to EUR24.00. Depending on your budget we found this quite expensive and didnt want to go back! The hotel is a little out of the main area of Madrid but the Metro is close by and the links to the centre are good. Prices for the Metro are so much lower than London so we were happy to use it as much as possible. There is a lot of walking around between lines which is odd so comfy shoes is a must. All in all this hotel was very pleasing. We would go back to it when we go back to madrid because the price and style i dont think you would get anywhere in the centre of madrid! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “unique, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: terryseal
Reviews.Content: While researching hotels to stay in Madrid, I happened across a review of this hotel. It sounded very cool and worth a visit on its own. (Assuming it lived up to the hype.) One potential negative was that it was away from the city center. For the most part we didn't find this a huge problem, although we did have trouble finding available late night food in the neighborhood close to the hotel. Also, when you're tired from traipsing around the city all day, sometimes you wish your hotel was a bit closer to get back to. Exploring each floor was an experience in and of itself. The designs of some of them are amazing. Even the design of the elevators, with most of it being glass, affording a grand view, is amazing. We picked the stark white Kathyrn Findlay designed room, which costed extra money. I guess it's in high demand. I did notice that, due to the design, some cracking in the plaster and what not. I suppose with such a build, it might be hard to keep it maintained. But the room was generally comfortable and interesting. The queen/king sized bed was comfortable, especially consider our other Spain hotels had the usual two twin beds put together. One funny moment was that we used the pool at night, but there was a party going on in the bar. We became the entertainment for the evening! It was a little unsettling to say the least. We had to even wade through some of the party crowd in our bathrobes to get to the elevator. They could have made the pool area a -little- more private! All and all, worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: locomota
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Silken Puerta America. Amazing design all around, great service and excellent food. Other reviews have commented on the distance from the city centre: it's 20 minutes on the metro and, when you think about how much extra you would pay if this place was any closer to town, we couldn't object.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel but not a five-star”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bug_Will
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I bid for a 5-star hotel in central Madrid and Priceline mistakenly put us in this hotel outside of the central area. It turns out "okay" as the hotel is close to the metro and we could get to the central area in 30 mins. The design of the hotel is very unique, kind of like a theme hotel, and it is worth a visit. But the quality of the construction made me wonder how this place can be rated a 5-star hotel. The wall is so thin you can literally hear people walking outside the door, day or night. And if you neighboring room is using the blow-dryer or the bathroom then you'll heard all about it as well. Maybe it is only a problem on the floor we stayed on (all the floors have a unique theme/design, we stayed on the 7th floor with the space theme). I will consider coming back again if I can get a good deal (like $100/night) but I would not pay full 5-star price for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “grate but became old”
Reviews.Author: BANDARi_11
Reviews.Content: my and my family staid at this hotel in Nov 2011 , honstely the service was very nice and the breakfast is incredible the only 2 observation may be the location and that carbit and the finishing of the stunning decoration became old and need to be mentained

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoadKing68
Reviews.Content: Nothing negative to report.....which is fantastic. It is a long way into the city center via bus/metro, but it was convenient for my business meetings. If you are need to stay near here, a good option. If you are a tourist, stay closer to the city center if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great service AND great design!”
Reviews.Author: YetAnotherViajera
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Puerta America has been on my "bucket list" of hotels to try for several years. I was expecting to be blown away by its design, but I wasn't really expecting it to offer such great service. But, from check-in to departure, everyone seemed to go out of their way to make our visit exceptional. We wanted some extra towels for our room, and someone appeared at our door with them almost immediately. We made a dinner reservation, and they spent ten minutes describing the menu options and recommending the perfect pre-dinner cocktail. We asked for room-service breakfast as soon as they started serving because we had an early flight, and they actually arranged to get breakfast to our room 30 minutes BEFORE they officially begin breakfast service. A couple of tips and suggestions: - We spent 30 minutes or so checking out each floor of the hotel - then realized that they offer tours several times a day. Sign up for a tour as soon as you arrive. - If you eat in the main dining room (which we highly recommend - food and service were fabulous), be sure to check out the tea cart. I have never seen such an extensive selection of teas before.

Reviews.Title: “Look but don't touch”
Reviews.Author: Rafaelstravels
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment!!!! had read a lot and seen the pictures of Silken Puerta America but all the expectations started to crumble down as soon as I entered the hotel. It's all talk but no show. As soon as you get close you realise how low quality the hotel is. Before letting you approach to the room they should give you a course on how to operate it - I've never been in a more complicated hotel room - it was impossible to understand how to operate the lights and open the shades - terrible. Will never again return

Reviews.Title: “Unusual hotel - great if you like something different!”
Reviews.Author: Londongirl4105
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2011 for a long weekend, upon arrival you get to choose your room...each floor has a different style to it! I think we stayed on the 4th Floor, our room was really nice, the bedroom and bathroom opened up into one but you could close it if you wanted. Not the best location but would much rather stay here as it was so nice than in the centre of Madrid where the hotels did not seem so great. The Sky bar at the top of the hotel was always busy and more of a club on fri & sat nights which we loved. Staff were really helpful...no complaints and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good.”
Reviews.Author: EvaNilsson
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband in Zaha Hadid's white room for a short but very enjoyable getaway. Our first impression was very good as reception staff were outstanding. Very welcoming and professional. We frankly did not know what to expect because communication via email prior and during the booking process was less than attentive. The face to face experience was a very pleasant surprise. Zaha Hadid's white room is built in fibreglass like material, in one piece. The only movable piece of furniture is a chair. We found this to be unique and we enjoyed the design, I reckon it is not for everybody, but then again there is a number of rooms for you to choose from. The bathtub was a big hit for us. My husband is 6' 7" (1.98 cm) and although we aren't overweight, it's never easy for us to soak together after a full day sightseeing. I had objected to staying in this hotel, because the weather was very hot and I wished to stay somewhere with an outdoors swimming pool. Silken Puerta America has a very small indoor swimming pool, which we did not visit. The room was clean. If I was to fault something, it would be the carpet. Carpets are favoured by hotels but let's face it, they are unhygienic, and not matter what you do to it, you can never clean it like you clean a hard floor. Further to this, giving the illusion that a white carpet is clean is even more difficult than doing so with a coloured one, but then again, if keeping the carpet seemingly clean is not possible, perhaps it should be replaced for a different type of flooring. Other than this, we greatly enjoyed having complementary soft drinks and Molton Brown toiletries. The offer we booked included a bottle of wine and fine chocolate. We were given the bottle of wine and fine chocolate. It was only two truffles, but then again, I don't care for chocolate. We were offered newspapers, but they never materialised. There was only two pillows in the room and when I requested two more these were brought up immediately. The person who took the call was beautifully mannered. We were concerned that the room might be noisy, but this was not the case at all. We slept soundly and weren't disturbed at all. The location is what it is and you see this reflected in the discounted fares. We did not mind the short underground ride from the town centre. Bottom line: If you are looking for the kind of overly fussy service you get at the Ritz, go to the Ritz. This kind of (lesser) five star facility is closer to the kind of service you receive at the five star Radisson Blu hotels, for instance, and we prefer this anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Designer paradise”
Reviews.Author: david36_11
Reviews.Content: First time here - a designer's paradise, mainly for better (occasionally for worse where aesthetics overrules functionality, as in the case of open-plan rooms with toilets with glass doors and no latch. You need to know your room-mate pretty well for that one). But this is still a lovely hotel, with excellent staff, friendly and knowledgeable, and the best breakfasts we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Completely unique!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_6282
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unique in every aspect: from the brightly coloured exterior, to the japenese-inspired lobby (that smells great!), to each floor by a different designer. We stayed on the first floor, designed by Zaha Hadid. The room was very much what you see in the pics...white and space-ship like! The bed was a bit hard, but comfortable. The staff were friendly upon check-in, although we did wait quite a while to check in as people before us made their room selections on the iPad. We accepted the challenge to see and photograph each floor, and it was a lovely expedition, awaiting the surprise as the elevator opened on each floor. The toiletries in the Zaha Hadid room were by Molten Brown, although I am sure that there were good products on the non-club floors as well. We did not have breakfast, as it was extortionately expensive. We chose to rather visit the little 'croissanterie' just 2 streets behind the hotel where we bought delicious toasted croissants, churros and cafe con leches...for 2 people cost us 6 Euro! My only complaint about the Zaha Hadid floor would be that the door to the corridor is not very sound-proofed, and you can hear practically everything thats going on outside. In contrast, there is a busy freeway right in front of the hotel that you cannot hear at all, as the front windows are nicely soundproofed. I mentioned this problem to reception upon checkout. The minibar in the club room was free (non alcoholic drinks only), and we were never short of any drinks. The minibar was replenished daily. I thought this was a nice touch! Fluffy bathrobes and slippers are provided in the room. The location IS indeed very close to the Cartegena metro stop (as people have mentioned here before), and you can even walk to and from the Avenida de America stop (the bus 200 from the airport stops at this stop). However, we felt the metro was not as convenient as we would have liked. With barely any restaurants/activities near the hotel, we had to make several trips per day to and from Madrid centre. The Cartegena metro stop does not connect easily with the other popular lines, so we found that several line changes were necessary to get to where we wanted to go. This can be annoying after a long day of sightseeing, especially as the change in connection is often long walks and escalators inside the metro station. Due to this reason, I would say the hotel is not very convenient in terms of location. On the other hand, if you are looking for a quality stay, and a spotlessly clean and luxurious hotel, and you are prepared to travel to the city only once a day (or by taxi, or you dont mind walking alot) then Puerta Silken America is for you. I would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “When the design is not enough to be a five star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MariaCoimbra
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in this hotel! This is a hotel that we consider to be an authentic interactive museum of contemporary design. And so it is with regret that we realize that there are situations that happen that do not correspond to a five star hotel! Being woken up at 8 o'clock in the morning with the noise of cleaning can not be understood as a high standard as expected in a five star hotel! How can a client be disturbed so early in the morning? How is it possible to have so much technology and so little soundproofing? We contacted the front desk stating that the cleaning staff had interrupted our sleep and we did not have conditions to rest, the reception answered that they would contact with the cleaning team to stop the cleaning immediately. And in fact the cleaning team left the room next to ours but yet they moved to other rooms increasing the noise with the use of vacuum! Under these conditions it was not possible to return to rest! We inform the hotel of what happened using a comment in the hotel's own website and the answer was they are trying to improve the soundproofing of the rooms and that they emphasize the cleaning team to respect fully the rest of customers, especially at certain hours in the morning! We can only fully agree! But the truth is that despite the fine words we were woken up at 8 o'clock in the morning! We hope that in future this hotel can improve these aspects, because we believe that all that design should be recognized also by the comfort it offers to its customers!

Reviews.Title: “Very interesting and original”
Reviews.Author: Lynch85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very unique indeed, each floor was fascinating and so different. We were orginally allocated a room on the tenth floor which we were not very keen on. The whole room was black and felt too oppressive for us so we asked to be moved, we were moved to the seventh floor and the room was absolutley fabulous. Very interesting, impecably clean, high quality fixtures and fittings and just a totally unique hotel experience! The spa was fantastic too. We usually prefer to stay in traditional hotels in old buildings but this was a refreshing change as despite it being modern it was rammed full of character. The only downside for us was the location, we would have preferred somewhere closer to the city centre!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: efjhells
Reviews.Content: The hotel is truly unique: floors of differing modern design with high quality fixtures in the rooms and around the hotel in general. This makes for a different feel to your usual vacation or business-built building. And, one would say unusually for Madrid, the staff value good customer service with a smile - they appear to enjoy working there! We booked this as part of a British Airways holiday package and paid a very reasonable rate. From the moment you arrive the hotel has a 5 star feel to it - bags taken care of, efficient check-in (with options to choose rooms displayed on an i-Pad) and good access to the rooms. The facilities are good - 2 restaurants, a bistro, a great bar and patio and a good sky-level nightclub. We were there for 4 days celebrating 40th birthdays and always enjoyed part of our evening in the hotel. The nearest underground station was a 2-min walk away and taxis are sat outside in a rank all day long. Perfect for a city break without paying silly central prices. Bottom line - if you're going to Madrid, don't bother wasting your time searching for hotels (as we did). Cut to the chase and include this at the top of your short-list!! Trust Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Totally different modern design... fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: lev1212
Reviews.Content: My husband just came back from celebrating our 10th anniversary in Spain. We did Priceline for hotels and wanted a 5 star. When we were told that Silken Puerta America was our hotel, I was very nervous, We have a traditional, Victorian home - modern is not our look at all. Plus the location did not look close to the city center. However, once we arrived our concerns were quickly eased. We choose an all white, non-smoking, private toliet, room - 8th floor. Granted the room seemed spartan to us - nothing on the walls, no rugs, every single thing white - bed was very firm with only only thin blanket. Not exactly luxurious... but it was fun to stay in a hotel that was so different from our usual. The customer service was amazing! The airline lost our luggage and each day the terrific staff who was all fluent in English would call and email for us. The staff could not have been friendlier. They were also great at giving tourist suggestions and helping us navigate the subways, bus and trains. The location was not ideal. But it really was fine. We always took the subway and it was so easy from the hotel. In the end, the location was not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 way to celebrate my 30th!”
Reviews.Author: elaine w
Reviews.Content: Wow, an amazing hotel! So different and we had a great stay. Each of the floors is different and the whole hotel is beautiful! So glad we stayed in the room we did, neutral and calm (some of the other rooms look a bit crazy). Room was spotlessly clean and had all toiletries you could think of. The lifts and clear floor balcony were a great extra too, some beautiful views. We got this deal very reasonably and could never afford to stay here in the real world, all extras were soooo expensive. Went up to the club/bar Friday evening, but again expensive, had a good vibe but full of pretty people! The pool and steam room were a bonus too, which we used every day! Staff overall seemed very helpful and friendly. Good location, metro literally few mins away (as is a local super market). We had such a fab stay, just be ware of pick pocketers on the metro as we found out on our last morning!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent services, innovative design”
Reviews.Author: daisy h
Reviews.Content: Came to the puerta silken hotel in June with one of my friends as a female trip. Read all the reviews which really helped in making our decision to come here, which let me make clear WAS NOT a regrettable one :) Each floor is designed differently! I know a lot of the rooms were quite open plan or 'tasteful'. If privacy is an issue for you then choose the 6th floor which is where we stayed, bathroom separate compared to some other rooms. You do get to choose your room upon arrival though so you can decide then. The room was very spacious and clean, the bathroom was great with a separate bath and shower, the pressure of which was good.There is also storage space which consists of chest of drawers and a wardrobe for those of you who dont like to live out of your suitcase! The only little thing i would mention that i was quite disappointed about was the no access to the balcony but there were windows and an air conditioning system so after that it never became a problem! Room service was also good and relatively quick. the spa facilities are ok, there is a gym, sauna and swimming pool all located on the top floor but quite small. Along with the spa and gym, there is also a night bar called 'sky night bar' which is great with some fantastic views :) Another bar is located downstairs which is good, staff were very friendly though prices were just a little more than reasonable however not compared to the restaurant opposite which we found rather expensive! At basement level there is a breakfast buffet which i have to say was amazing! Great range of fresh food, but also quite expensive at 27 euros for one person for one day. In case anyone is wondering internet access for us was not free but very cheap, not sure if the hotel has any other facilities such as free wifi or conference rooms to address this. The area of the hotel is good, its location is right next to a metro station which allows you to get around madrid and around 25 minutes from the airport by bus which is much cheaper than a taxi! Past the local metro station there are restaurants and shops you can go to and further down is the bus station all within 10 minutes walk of the hotel. Although the hotel isnt quite close to downtown, the metro is within reach and allows you to get to the heart of madrid within 20-30 minutes. Overall the stay was great! No problems with noise, the staff were excellent in helping us get around, polite and great at finding things for us to do. I would definitely recommend this hotel and go back again! Dont let the location or innovation deter you from choosing one of the best hotels in madrid :)

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, interesting if occasionally impractical”
Reviews.Author: Skelligman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here over 20 times and experienced most of the varied designs over the different floors. Some of these are focused a little too much on style at the expense of practicality, or sometimes of comfort, with baffling bathroom fittings and controls and hidden storage and fridges. But the best of them - like those by Arata Isozaki, Mariscal & Salas and Norman Foster - are really fabulous to experience. You can view the different It is not a cheap hotel - drinks and restaurants are a bit steep - but quality is good and service generally helpful and attentive. There is a very small gym and an equally bijou swimming pool up on the 13th floor from where there are some great views. Location is some way out of the centre but it's easy to get to and from the airport one of the main Metro hubs at Avenida de America is only a few hundred meters away.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: David_jburns
Reviews.Content: Staying in big city hotels is often very boring, you wake up and could be anywhere... However. this is something very different. I woke up to what can only be described as the bridge of the starship enterprise. I reached for the tv remote and a huge projector screen rolled down to display the news, I then pressed another button on my remote to turn the lights on that surrounded my round bed. This hotel is awesome I keep trying to find excuses to return to Madrid so we can try the other floors available! Recommend if you like things that are not boring.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BM78
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in this hotel and I was very impressed. A stylish hotel with excellent service. The individually designed floors are a very nice touch. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and immaculate. The bars are excellent with superb service from the staff and a wide range of drinks available. The restaurants were excellent too with wonderful buffet breakfasts and lunches complimented by a la carte evening options. Location wise it's about 15 minutes on the metro to the centre (Sol) but a 10 journey metro pass was €9.50 so it's no real issue unless you must stay in the centre. The airport is only a 15 minute drive away which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fashion hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Araeinar
Reviews.Content: Its funny to walk in the hotel cos everyfloor is different. Rooms really good. If you want to eat or drink something is expensive. Not to close from the center but if you like to walk you can do it if not the subway is 5 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unconventional and fun”
Reviews.Author: uprisesthemoon
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights on the all-white, Star-Trekky 8th floor. A fascinating hotel that makes you want to stop on every floor, just to look around. Super friendly and helpful staff, great room service food, and a feast for the eyes everywhere you look. Minor downsides were a really small (but totally functional) gym, and a location that's definitely off the beaten path (not a ton of stuff nearby, but just a couple short blocks to the Cartagena metro stop, and a few blocks more to the Avenida de America stop). Recommended for anyone looking for a modern experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, incompetent and unhelpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: luis f
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very interesting concept. It was designed by 14 diferent architects, each given pretty the flexibility to do whatever he/she wanted. Eventough location is not good for a torist traveler, we decided to overview this fact and reserve. We liked so much the different rooms, we decided to make 3 consecutive reservations of 1 night each, specifying we wanted non-smoking rooms (three of their floors are smoking floors and smell like it). We specicaly paid about $50 more to get a suite the second night to assure we got different rooms. First time in our lives we do that but we thought the hotel worth the sacrifice. The rooms are out of this world! Really. That much was good. Hallways in each floor are equally amazing! If you can deal with lousy service you should try the place. The lobby is laim. Nowhere up to par with the upper floors. Breakfast is really good and price is a little high (about $45 per person). Then the service. 2 people checking in 10 guests and they took about 8 minutes per guest. We waited in line half an hour for the initial check-in. About 15 minute wait for the 2 subsequent stays. The second night was the suite. At the reception they simply said we did not have a suite. We showed the reservation paying a higher rate and showing the suite election. The receptionist disregarded this and said this must have been a mistake with Expedia. We never got any money back and they gave us a standard room. We chose a room that was pretty dark. It was nice but with black walls, ceiling and floor, the next day we realized some inconveniences could arise. When we packed to move to the third room we left our passports (blue covers) and didn't notice. Checking out of our final night and preparing to return to Miami, we could not find our passports. We were certain these were in the second room and called the reception. They said they would check immediately. After 20 minutes we called back and they said they checked and did not find anything. We asked them to look again and said in was to early to knock on the door to a guest (11 a.m.) and they would have to wait until later. We explained our international flight left in two hours. They couldn't care less. It wasn't a shirt we left. It was our passports! Frustrated we decided to go to the Airport to try to move our flight one day at least with the over cost and complications. Once in the elevator we decided to stop at the room and knock ourselves. Nobody opened. Then the housekeeper of the floor shows up and tell us she never looked and as a matter of fact, she saw that guest leave the room early in the morning!! Now we are really upset. It is probalby too late to catch our flight anyways. The lady was very nice once she realized the situation, walked in and came back with one passport! Great but we are missing the second one. The second had fallen between the table and the bed and on a second search she found it. My wife, who would get in BIG trouble at work if she didn't showed up, hugged her and gave her a kiss.... and a tip. We ran down to check out to find the same slow arrogant service and several guests and from the back told with joy and frustration both receptionists we had found our passports. At the begining they didn't even knew what we were talking about. Then one said, oh yes, that. And shekept doing her thing like nothing happened. All people in line realized the urgency of the situation, as oppossed to the employee's who lied to us about looking for the passports and did not even react. Everyone let us go through and check-out of the Silken Puerta America for the last time in our lives.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful wonderful wonderful”
Reviews.Author: stephenandmichelle
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 superb days at this holiday for our wedding anniversary. Wonderful hotel. Read that some people have found it too far out from the centre, which didn’t cause us any problems – on arrival at Madrid airport, get the metro down to Cantigna stop, the hotel is about 100 metres from here. A 3 day metro pass to include all transport is around 13euros, very cheap, and it takes about 20 minutes with the various stops into the centre this way. There is a taxi rank right outside too, and a trip into the city this way is around 7 euros, journey time about 5 minutes depending on day and time. On first sight, the hotel is fantastic, the exterior is superb and the inside a breath of fresh air. On arrival you receive an ipad to choose which room you want, which is very novel and a great way to start the stay. The room was wonderful, with a great view from the rear of the hotel of the 4 towers at the far end of the city. Our bed faced the window and this wonderful view, and everything in the room was clean, fresh, tidy and well maintained. You can stop off at all the floors and have a wander round the different designs. On top of that, on our arrival we were greeted with a bottle of champagne and chocolates to celebrate our anniversary, which was a wonderful touch and highly appreciated. We managed to use the small pool on the top floor a couple of times and found this a lovely tranquil place after a hard day of sight-seeing. We were a bit worried about the price of food and drink before arriving, unfortunately some of this was a bit outside our price range -the nightclub (which is worth a visit for the panoramic view alone, though 2 drinks cost 25 euros!!), the ground floor bar was reasonably priced (11euros for 2 large wines) and a great way to start the evening before going for a meal. We didn’t eat an evening meal in one of the hotel restaurants, but our stay did include breakfast (which we pre booked by the tour operator, which worked out at under half the daily price than if we had booked on arrival) – and this is superb. I cannot emphasise enough the quality of the buffet breakfast – everything you could want and more, it really set us up for the days sightseeing. Well worth the money, as I say if you book it as part of your stay and if it works out reasonable for your budget. You save the money on having to have lunch anyway! The minbar was very over-priced, yet next to the metro stop down the road is a Carrefour minimart, which is very cheap (6 bottles of estrella for 2.20 euros or bottle of good quality champagne or wine for 4 euros, compared to 35 euros for the minibar red wine (one glass size!), so make sure you stock up here for supplies…. I cannot recommend the hotel enough, never stayed somewhere like this before, just the quality of the stay, the way you are treated (all staff were excellent) and the luxurious surroundings. If you are a couple like us, whom have to save a few months to afford a weekend away, then it is well worth the saving – it is a little pricy, but if you get a good deal (we paid 400 euros for 3 nights including breakfast, the usual price according to their tariff book in the room is around 750-800 euros per night, breakfast 25 euros each), then it is more than worth it. Also a last tip – if you don’t fancy a trek into the centre, turn right out of the hotel entrance, walk 100m past the metro and carry on for around another 50m, the Italian pizzeria on the corner, La Tagliatella (or something like that) – amazing and well worth the trip. All in all, check it out. Wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Creative design, that challenges the norm!”
Reviews.Author: RosB__11
Reviews.Content: This is such an interesting hotel. It has an ultra-modern feel and the designers were not afraid to challenge conventional hotel design. It completely differentiates itself from any hotel I have ever stayed in. I was on a conference and the delegates were abuzz with architectural chit chat and comparisons. Many visited various floors just to see what the respective rooms looked like! I stayed on the 7th floor and loved the clinical grey and white theme, round bed and projector/screen TV. Although not in the centre of Madrid, the hotel is conveniently located close to a tube station, making it quick and cheap to travel into the city centre. Service was excellent all round although drinks were very expensive. The only real critisism I had was that there was no tea and coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and unique hotel, 15m from centre on metro/train”
Reviews.Author: watford-soros
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and worth seeing - we stayed on level 9 on a non-smoking floor, with the entire building very impressive. The staff are helpful overall, but possibly not to 5* standard. The cocktails in the bar excellent – I have never seen a drink prepared with such love and attention (but we were the only two in the bar at the time) although expensive at 12-16 Euros each. The hotel is not right in the centre, but you have two train (metro) stations within a couple of mins walk. For breakfast, I would highly recommend a small, local bakery which is a block away (2m walk) if you come out of the front of the hotel, go right and 1st right again - then walk straight down the connecting road and its directly infront of you. Breakfast for 2 here costs 10-12 Euros max here, with the hotel charging an extortionate 25 Euros for one full English breakfast. The bar at the top of the hotel is worth a visit on fri/sat and is full of the jet set, but again is expensive. The pool is disappointing as its small, dark and indoors which is a shame. Use the iPad at reception to choose your own floor, which is very cool, as the hotel staff try to allocate you a room. To reach the hotel take the 200 bus from the airport – costs 1.50 each, and takes 20mins max, with the hotel quoting 82 Euros for a one way trip in a taxi. Overall a good place if you get a good deal as its worth seeing for the different floors and layouts, but can be expensive if you eat/drink there.

Reviews.Title: “Different but very nice”
Reviews.Author: Matt F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really very interesting. Upon check in, I was given an iPad and told to choose my room. This was very fun, I got to choose between 3 floors, the clerk checking me told me about each floor, the designer, and whether or not it was a good room for working in. My first room wouldn't cool down, and after a few calls down to the front desk they moved me to a new room with working AC. The bar on the rooftop is interesting and offers a great view of Madrid in the evening, that is if you don't mind paying 17 euros for a cocktail. My only issue with was that the hotel really isn't in walking distance to anything, you will need to take a taxi or the metro everywhere you go, That said, the rooms were nice, comfortable, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “An hotel that is really different”
Reviews.Author: PKDan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the centre of activities but it is close to one of the interesting barios typical of the old Madrid business life. However It is, like most of the inner circle of the City only about 10 Euros taxi drive from the Plaza Colon, Puerto de Sol, Plaza Mayor, Cuzco, The Bernabao Stadium and the plaza Castilla. Arriving at the Hotel I found the staff to be extremely helpfull and friendly. At this point you can use a screen at reception to choose your room if you have not prebooked. All the rooms on each floor are identical with a diferent designers idea for each floor, all of which are interesting, if somewhat strange at times. It imakes a change to find the the hotel has 3 floors of smoking rooms (I do not smoke) which are of an excellent standard. I really liked the look of the rooms on one of these floors so I stayed in one and could not tell tell the difference. It was clean and had no smell or signs of tobacco. It was also modern, roomy with a very good selection of toiletries etc., a well stocked mini bar, free wifi. and multi channel TV The thirteenth floor is home to three things; a really modern night bar, which catered to all ages and didn't overley charge for the drinks and was well attended by a cross miix of ages. a small fitness centre with modern equipment, a sauna/Turkish bath and a closed in swimming pool. The latter was narrow and long, great for exercise but not for games though interesting to see how many lengths you can do underwater without coming up for air (2.5 honest!) The third thing was a glass floor walkway round the outside of the lift, a very unerving experience but certainly different and worth braving to photograph your feet so far above ground. I did not avail myself of any of the various restaurants (although I am sure they would have been of a standard to match the quality of the hotel) because I believe hat Madrid is home to some of the best restaurants anywhere in Europe, for both quality and value, and this visit reconfirmed my faith. My visit to Madrid was fairly short but I have always loved the City and I would be pleased to stay in this hotel in the future given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel but a little out of town centre”
Reviews.Author: loztravels
Reviews.Content: When you walk into this hotel you really can't fail to be impressed by the architecture; really cutting edge modern design. This is reflected in the rooms and lobbies of each floor - each designed by a different big name architect. You can seriously just spend half an hour visiting each floor! The restaurant does good fine dining and wines. The bar in the tip floor was kicking on a Friday night when we went and the spa is amazing as well. Staff and service was faultless. The only issue was that you are a 15-min tube journey from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable hotel..amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Kevinaj22
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in the world, each floor designed by a different famous designer each with its own incredible theme! We stayed near the top floor in a japanese theme room which was just amazing, the best hotel we have ever been to its just incredible..i dont even know how to describe it!!! There are no faults, wel maybe one, we had it on a budget last min deal soo it was pretty cheap for us but the cost of food and drinks etc are a little pricey, when i say a little i mean £25 for a boiled egg on toast!! I say no more....

Reviews.Title: “stay if you get a good deal :)”
Reviews.Author: hullpixi
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay here for my birthday mid-august, booked direct through their website and got their SOS summer deal, 91 Euros for one night with late (3pm) check out and a free bottle of wine. Extremely disappointed with the reception staff on arrival, his name was Denis I believe. He could not find my booking and was very patronising and after a few reluctant phone calls my booking was found. Not one apology from him. Bad start to the stay, even more it was my birthday and this stress was very unecessary. On finding the booking he decided that he would chose the room for us, rather than letting us have a look ourselves first, however I insisted that he let us look ourselves at the rooms on the Ipad and again he was very stroppy saying that most of the rooms wouldn't accomodate the baby cot. The room we did choose (10th floor), he was adamant the cot wouldn't fit and rang to check, they said it would, so we got the room WE wanted. When we got to the room it was obvious it could have accomodated 3 of the travel cots! The rest of the staff perfect. Everything else overpriced but glad I stayed as I have wanted to stay in this hotel for years and the SOS summer deal we got was worth it. The baths on the 10th floor are fab but took about 40 mins to fill, and ironically there is a sign next to it saying 'Madrid needs water'! We ate out at an Argentine restaurant not far from the hotel and was delicious. Another tip, if you dont want to pay the extortion they charge for drinks/minibar, there's a Carrefour round the corner, get some beers there and stash them in the minibar to keep cool ;) A lot of people have been whingeing about the pool/gym, no it's not big and yes it's dark and unsual but boy I was glad for a swim after a day in the Madrid August heat! At one point there was only us in there, was fab! I wouldn't want to stay there as a tourist as it is far from the centre. Oh and I recommend the glass floor walkway on the 13th floor :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: moaksey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in July this year. The photos looked intruiging, the reviews spot-on and the price was great (we got a special deal). The different themes on each floor looked appealing too. The biggest worry we had was location, which proved to be a non-issue. You're not in the middle of Madrid - but you're not far away - and you get to see a different neighbourhood which is always a good thing, right? Taxis from the centre aren't much at night either and the hotel is really easy to find. The tube stations nearby make it really convenient to get around too. We stayed in a room on the Isozaki floor which was great. I loved the design of the whole place though and have never stayed in anything like it. I had the best sleep I'd had in ages here. I hate siestas but had them there (when in Rome...) and they were great. I also had no problem getting to sleep at night and staying in bed in the morning. The room was so dark, quiet and peaceful. The bar on the ground floor was pleasant but what shocked us more was the club on the roof. As a hotel guest you'd never notice it was there as the place is well-soundproofed, but if you go up in the lift on a Friday or Saturday night you'll find the place absolutely heaving. We went up there two nights in a row and each night it was full of *beautiful people* - not exactly our crowd but it was fun, if expensive. We used the fitness facilities every day we were there. The pool is small but functional - just a shame it's not outdoors. The gym area is small aswell but has treadmills etc. The staff at the hotel are incredible and really make you feel welcome. I loved Madrid, I loved this hotel and next time I go back I'll definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back every year.”
Reviews.Author: Sunnysuffolklife
Reviews.Content: This was a special trip for myself and my boyfriend as after many years as friends we had just decided to take our friendship to a different level. Being our first trip away as a new couple we were very excited and this hotel was the perfect find. After reading the positive reviews we were looking forward to experiencing the hotel for ourselves. Neither of us were used to luxury quite to this standard and the hotel didnt disappoint. The staff were friendly and attentive, the hotel itself was beautiful and we had a fantastic three night stay. we'll definately be returning at the same time next year and hopefully for many years after that! The main resturant in the hotel was the highlight of our trip and although it was very expensive for such a special weekend we had the most perfect evening. The food was outstanding, the service faultless and we spent 4 perfect hours savouring the tastes and the atmosphere of spanish dining. I would recomend getting the 3 day travel card which we actually purchesed on the outbound flight and picked up at the airport. For about 13 euros it gives you unlimited use of the transport system in Madrid and if you are going to be exploring the City it can also offer various discounts on different activities. The hotel is about 20 minutes out from the city centre by underground but the transport system is so easy to navigate and with the travel card being good value for money it wasn't a problem for us!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: BetoChristo
Reviews.Content: We were planing to stay in the city center, our stay happened in the same time the city was hosting a world youth christian meeting and the Pope visit, the city was very busy, city center was closed, we could barely move around the streets. Thank God we decided to stay at Silken Puerta America, besides being the most trendy hotel we have stayed in Europe, its services can be rated the best I have experienced in Europe (I only had the same kind of service in Thailand). The staff did more than we needed, the location is great, just five minutes walking from Cartagena Subway Station that links you to all places in Madrid. The breakfast follow the high quality of the Thai hotels. I strongly recommend this nice hotel. The interior decor was more than superb.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous base for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: hick
Reviews.Content: After much deliberating about whether to stay here or to have a base in the town centre, we were fairly apprehensive as we drew up at the hotel. However, as soon as we arrived in reception we knew it was the right decision. I thouroughly recommend this quirky hotel. The service was fantastic, everything we could have wanted for our stay. The metro system is very clean, cheap and efficient, no problem getting into the centre of town. We ate out in Madrid each night so I can't comment on the restaurant but breakfast was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkManama
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights on the 10th floor (can't remember the designer, high emphasis on black though). The i-pad at check-in is cool, reception tells you which floors are available, you then pick the floor based on the pics on the i-pad. Location was good for me as it was close to where I needed to be for work, but it might be a bit far for tourist purposes? Breakfast was fabulous (but you do pay for it..), service was good, there is a bar on the top-floor with great views, music and drinks. Also a long pool, good for swimming (not really for splashing around). The gym is tiny however. All in all a good experience, it lives up to it's reputation

Reviews.Title: “At the bar every night, if only for a quick amazing cocktail!”
Reviews.Author: HiramNaman
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel, you get an interactive menu to choose your designer room. I changed rooms twice just to experience the other rooms. The designs aren't always user friendly, nor very practical, but the experience is great. Great service, great restaurants, but the greatest ground floor bar just because of the bar-woman from Brazil, Paola, I have never had such amazing cocktails in my life! Would go back just for one of her creations!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but watch out for the extras”
Reviews.Author: bluekieran
Reviews.Content: The themed rooms are fun and nearly everything about the hotel is very deserving of it's five-star rating - apart from prices of the hotel bar/restaurant, and the top floor night bar. 27 euros for an - admittedly good - buffet breakfast was simply not worth it, and 7 euros for a beer also felt like we were being taken advantage of. I'd recommend staying in the hotel, but (unless you can find a good deal where breakfast is included) eating and drinking elsewhere. There's a surprisingly nice Irish bar nearby, and a cerveceria that does simple breakfasts. One final niggle: they offer free wi-fi, but you have to keep logging back into it and the codes they give out at reception are only good for 24hrs, so you have to keep asking for fresh ones. A minor annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting experience but the novelty wears off...”
Reviews.Author: Verm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this wacky hotel. We stayed on the 7th floor in a white room with bright red bathroom and circular black bed. It was fun to be somewhere so different, but the novelty does wear off and we would have enjoyed Madrid just as much in a more conventional space. The hotel is bright and clean and the staff are helpful and charming. It is 5 star so service should be good. Prices are 5 star and we did not think 25 euros for breakfast was really worth the money. There is a nice bar on the ground floor with drinks, tea and coffee. We have no regrets about our stay and it is worth visiting other floors to see the wacky decor. The only negative is that the hotel is in the commercial district and there is nothing worth seeing in the immediate area (although there are a few restaurants). However, the Metro close by is brilliant and half an hour takes you to the Centro district. There is also a six-lane highway running past the hotel which does take the edge off outdoor dining/drinks. However, we couldn't hear this from our room. We have never stayed anytwhere like this before and would recommend it, but look for a deal. We don't think it's worth top price purely because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “This is almost designer museum”
Reviews.Author: PANDAFrankfurtAmMain
Reviews.Content: We spent our wedding anniversary in Madrid and choose this hotel after we studied a lot about hotels in Madrid. We were really happy that we decided the best one. Design-It’s amazing!!! Really nice made from world famous desigers. I stay in Zara Hadid room but next time I would like to stay in Roan Arad room!!! so nice Location was good-we took bus from airport to hotel and it was easy and go to city centre was easy wit subway. Service-Very helpful and I took some Spanish leagues lesson from hotel staff too. Food-Restaurant food was very good and service too. only bad things were they don't offer a kettle but brought a pot of hot water free. swimming pool was nice ...maybe in summer better with open roof??? I want to go back to Silke Puerta America hotel.

Reviews.Title: “we had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: tracysmith1970
Reviews.Content: me and my husband went for a weekend away ,,hotel was amazing we loved it ..every room differnt ,we picked the 11th floor for smoking (there are 3 floors for smokers) all floors are differntley designed by spanish designers ,,, the staff were very friendly and helpful ,tip... by reception there is a help screen with recommendations for restaurants and site seeing ,, dont use this it is purely for adverts,,,the conceirge at reception was amazing and helped us get 2 great restaurants (he also booked them for us )! there are buses to get in maine madrid but we used the metro ,,very easy and cheap ,, a 3 day pass was 13 euors each and this was for as many times as you needed it ... we will defo go back to thois hotel a very warm welcome helped by all the luxury freebies in the room ..enjoy ....

Reviews.Title: “Crack for the design-centric--but also just a good luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: BurgessMebane
Reviews.Content: So if you ever read design magazines, much less if you are a designer or architect, you want to stay here at least a few days. When you check in they show you the rooms that are available for your room type by designer. But ask to see the rooms themselves, because the pictures are actually not very helpful. Our room was much more boring in person than it appeared in the image. And part of the thrill is the lobbies--some of the more avant-garde ones are worth the trip. You can access all of them, but I think staying on that floor would make a difference to you. It's a luxury hotel, so the amenities are not cheap, but the service was excellent. Things were starting to fray around the edges here and there--might be time for some repainting and new bedspreads, but that's what happens with high design. And if your dream is to walk out the door of your hotel and into the Prado, don't stay here. But if you don't mind hopping the very easy, cheap, and convenient metro, you're a short walk from one of the main interchange stations (Av. America) and a shorter walk from a line that connects to it). Plus that walk takes you past another architecture/design wonder, the Torres Blancas apartment high-rise by Saenz de Oiza.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and even better staff”
Reviews.Author: chadshiver
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights in early June, and had an excellent experience. At check-in, you're shown a gallery of rooms on each floor on an iPad - important as each floor is designed by a different architect and they're all quite distinct from each other. We stayed on the Isozaki floor, and the room was very relaxing and great for sleeping late, as it was so dark. The hotel staff are where the property really shines. From check-in to check-out, every interaction with hotel staff was fantastic - in the lobby, the bars, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: TKB001
Reviews.Content: What do they do well: Breakfast is good (general continental breakfast options: eggs, cheese, bacon, fruits, etc), rooms are lovely, reception is helpful, free wifi, good night sleep in complete darkness and quiet and nice bar area (although it is a bit too close to the highway....they should plant some trees to separate it off a bit more). Areas that need improving: No free water, dvd player, no movies on demand, no free coffee in room, no turning the bed down, tiny gym (one treadmill, one stationary bike and couple of dumbbells of max 10kg) and non ideal location (30 mins from centre of Madrid by underground, 15mins by cab).

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerouackid
Reviews.Content: I have had great times at this hotel. Everything is as one would expect. The service is tremendous, the facilities are top notch, the design is wonderful and the metro is only a few steps away. I stayed here in June and August of last year (neglecting my tripadvisor duties). The first trip I stayed on Kathrin Findlay's 8th floor. When the elevators open you are transferred into another world. My second trip I stayed on Ron Arad's 7th floor. Same experience again upon exiting the elevator. The rooms are comfortable, stylishly designed and so amazingly different. The Attic (13th floor) is a great place & has a fantastic pool, bar and fitness center. There is always a number of people at the bar downstairs & has always been a great place to relax and meet people before heading out for the night. The restaurant is delicious. I have not found any faults with this hotel. I have always been treated very well and will continue to stay here when in Madrid. It is hard to describe how unique this hotel is. I suggest one visit the website to gain a better perspective.

Reviews.Title: “an amazing hotel. Breakfast - unbeatable!”
Reviews.Author: Playactor
Reviews.Content: My husband and his friend booked this hotel for the four of us but didn't let us see any photos of it before we arrived there and yes it was worth the surprise! When you arrive in the lobby, it is quite unassuming but this soon changes as you enter the corridor to your room, all of which are different. We stayed on the White floor. I think it's the 1st floor. We had the choice between a White and a black one and both couples chose the White one which is very futuristic and mad, in a good way. The bath/shower in this type of room wouldn't be good for those with limited mobility though so that's something to ask about for other floors, which, as I said, are all styled completely differently anyway. You can go and have a look at all the other corridors and there is a guided tour of all the floors too, which unfortunately we didnt get a chance to go on as it's in the afternoon but I'd say it's definitely worth a look at if you're around. There's a glass/see through platform on the top floor of the hotel too so head up and walk on it! If I was to fault anything, I would say the restaurant seemed very expensive. We didn't eat there and there did seem to be other options in the hotel but the metro was so nearby and we were out and about all day so we ate in the city. Your Brekkie will kep you going for most of the day anyway. Speaking of which.... Highlights no.1. Has to be the breakfast. Buffet style. It's gorgeous and extremely varied, fruit, pastries, breads, many varieties of potatoes and eggs as well as other hot foods, cereals,the list goes on and on! No. 2. The service was excellent from the moment we walked through the door No.3. The room and it's uniqueness No.4. The free cocktail we got was a nice touch

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Close to Metro, Odd Bathroom Design”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler55
Reviews.Content: First, the good things about this hotel. It is only one block from a metro stop. The rooms are very modern, clean and are quite large. The bathrooms are also large and the shower is very nice and roomy. The rooms are quiet (meaning you can't hear noise in the room from other rooms or from the hallway). When you check in they give you a couple of options for room designs to pick from. There is a Carrefour near the metro stop where you can by cheap water, snacks. It looks like they had a very fancy restaurant, bar and club at this hotel. We didn't try these...but they seemed trendy and popular. Be aware that you only share a room with someone you are close to. In the particular room design we had, one whole side of the bathroom was just a glass window/door. You could see everything going on in the bathroom. Infact, the only mirror in the room was facing this "open" side of the bathroom.
