So if one person wanted to use the mirror in the room they could see everything the other person was doing in the bathroom. Also, the bathroom is not sound proof at all. Another problem, the first day and the last day we were there we couldn't turn on the light in the bathroom. There were way to many switches in the room. The only complaint I have is that one night we called them to ask for more shaving cream. The lady said she was going to send it up right away to our room. We waited all night (didn't leave the room at all) and no one ever came up with the shaving cream. I would much rather they say "no" then lie. Overall, I recommend this hotel. It is a bit over priced, but I was happy it was clean and close to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back for sure”
Reviews.Author: Guizzi123
Reviews.Content: My company organized a corporate event at this hotel and I stayed there only for one night. Even if my stay was quite short, I was very impressed by all the services: the restaurant, the breakfast buffet, the staff, the room, the meeting room, the interior decoration, everything. I am planning to return to this hotel the next time I go to Spain!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing unique hotel, fabulous service - couldn't do more for us.”
Reviews.Author: Sah1980
Reviews.Content: I purposely booked this hotel for a 4 day trip to Madrid for my husbands 30th birthday. I was aware it was slightly out of town but being London commuters we had no problem jumping on the tube to get to the sights. It was definitely worth it! Unusual on the outside the interior is fabulous and as good as any other modern hotel in London such as the Sanderson or Covent Garden Hotel (where you would pay £250+ a night). The gin and tonics were the biggest and best (although priciest) we'd ever had and the michelin starred restaurant although quiet was equally gorgeous in decor and much better value. The food and service was amazing. Staff couldn't do enough to help - from allowing us to change rooms so we could try another floor (we did both 7 and 9) to lending us a plug adapter. Each room was spacious and the designs were outstanding. Probably not suited to a couple with traditional tastes - we loved it and the city and would happily recommend a trip to Madrid and staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! You have to go and see this!”
Reviews.Author: Geordie2009
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 3 nights in this hotel at the end of April. It is amazing and you have to go if you're thinking about hotels in Madrid. Great value, the rooms are great. When you're checking in they use an iPad to show you photos of the different floors and design of room they have available. Each floor is different. We stayed on the 6th floor and it was beautiful but all the rooms looked great. We were so surprised because we really didn't pay that much. There's a bar on the top floor which is beautiful too. Drinks are a little pricey in there but well worth one or two drinks for the venue. As for location, there is no problem whatsoever. It's great. Right next to the underground station cartagena. Everywhere you want to go in terms of going out and/or sightseeing is easy to get to on the underground. Don't listen to any of the reviews on here that tell you the location could be better. You are not going to get a better location other than middle of the city centre (which will cost alot more). Amazing hotel to go to as a couple looking to enjoy Madrid. I wish there was more like this around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: The Silken Puerta America has very interesting rooms. The decor on each floor also appears to be different, which makes for an interesting visual experience at the Silken Puerta America. Our room was generally very good with a separate bath and shower. The location is a bit out of the way, although it is close to transportation options. The hotel Internet was not free but was quite fast and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms. A must when you go to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Iknowhereitsat
Reviews.Content: Extremely nice dessign. I recomment to visit all the rooms and stay in a different one every stay. My favourite floor is the... couldn't tell! Though i don't think the 4th is too comfortable. Proffessional staff however sometimes cold. Nice breakfast buffet with quality products. Modern restaurant but overexpensive. The sky bar has very nice views of Madrid. In the summer they do parties in the garden downstairs next to the marmo bar. I was very upset with the swimming pool because it looks a lot bigger in the hotel photographs due to the mirror next to it. Good massages and friendly service in the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel, but fun and novel, with good customer service.”
Reviews.Author: LittleRover
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the novelty factor, and it did not disappoint. I stayed on the 6th floor, which has a minimalist style, pretty comfortable and relaxing. There were some minor design irritations, (eg it was almost impossible to get the shower gel out of the little cuboid containers it came in!!), but overall it was functional. The room was quiet at night and had an effective black-out curtain. Everything was clean and well-presented. There was free internet access, which was brilliant. I would definitely have valued tea and coffee-making facilities though, and I think it is reasonable to expect them in a 5 star hotel. The Marmo Bar is expensive (14 euros per cocktail), but the staff are very pleasant and helpful. The same can be said for the staff in the Mad Restaurant. I dined there several times and found the waiters exceptionally helpful and friendly. The food was excellent. The breakfasts were also great, with a huge range of foods to choose from. The hotel is only a few metres away from the nearest Metro station, and it is extremely easy to get anywhere you need to go. The Metro is clean, efficient, and very easy to use, even if you don't speak any Spanish. The gym is small (only one treadmill, so you have to time your visits carefully) but the equipment is modern. Unfortunately there is no air-conditioning, so it gets pretty hot after a few miles! The pool is small and rather too dimly lit for my taste, but is clean and stylish. Overall, I enjoyed my stay here, and would recommend it to anyone who is prepared to pay rather a lot for food and drink within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Form over function?”
Reviews.Author: dial888
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about my stay in this hotel – I’m a big sci-fi fan and looked forward to the 8th floor. That was the first small disappointment for me – being unable to book a room on a floor before the day of my stay. Surely the hotel could have a booking system that allows the specification of a particular floor, especially since they make such a song and dance about how each one is so individual? I had a look at each of the lobbies on all 13 floors and have to say they were all stunning. 8th and the 4th (the one that’s like a metal labyrinth) were my favourites. Made for some great photos. I was overwhelmed by the aesthetic of the room when I first entered – a truly amazing look. After a day or two though I started to notice the odd annoying thing. For example the bath is dangerous. This may sound silly, but the floor of the bath is bevelled and there are no walls higher than shin height, so anyone who likes something to lean on whilst getting in and out of the shower may be on slightly shaky ground here. Another few minor gripes: the fridge is tiny, the aircon is pretty noisy and don’t expect to get a good long sleep in the morning as the doors are very thin and you can hear everything on the hard floored corridors outside – especially the chatty/shouty staff. Also something that really annoyed me was the lifts – I’m a smoker so had to use them pretty frequently (no smoking at all in the hotel) and having to swipe my room card every time I pressed the button started to get annoying – especially as it sometime took 3 attempts. I’m not sure how well this system would work in an emergency. Also, the location was a bit of a chore. It is very close to a metro, but anywhere you want to go will be at least 2 changes away. At first it doesn’t seem to make much difference, but soon I found myself wishing for the location of my previous hotel in the Sol area. Oh and the bar is extortionate – think I paid around 9 euro for a beer – they really seem to exploit their captive audience. My main annoyance though was the internet access. For such a stylish and modern hotel I would have expected a good wi-fi service (which is advertised). But alas it wasn’t. We could only connect ONE DEVICE. I hooked up the laptop but when I tried to connect with the iphone I was told that I was exceeding my quota. I could live with that, but even on the laptop the speeds were super slow. I’m talking 56k modem speeds. The internet without broadband it seemed. I mentioned this to reception and they gave me an Ethernet cable (charging for the privilege) and guess what? The holes that were supposed to hold the ports in my room were just holes. A member of staff had to come up and take apart the bed and pull wires from the console to get access to the ports. As I type this review there are cables on display and the facade has bits ripped off. So yes – a truly beautiful hotel. But spending a bit of time on functional aspects in addition to the unique design would have helped. I notice the standard rates are around 800-1200 euro per night (we paid 120 through a secondary site) – definitely not worth that. Probably worth the 120 though, at least for a couple of nights. We stayed in another city centre hotel for the main part of our Madrid visit and that’s an approach I’d recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel”
Reviews.Author: PWindsor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend on the 9th floor, as others have pointed out each floor was designed by a different famous designer. The location is a little out of the way however once you get the hang of the metro and realise the distances aren't that huge you can walk places within reason. Would recommend if your going to have breakfast book it as part of your package as it is a little expensive but well worth the money and sets you up for the rest of the day. Very much a 5* hotel and the staff are always very friendly and helpful. They speak English and Spanish so language is not a problem. The bell boys were always good for a quick joke. The swimming pool and gym are nice but the pool is very small although well worth a visit just to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Feature hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gabbio
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. service is impecable, the location is a bit far away from city center, but the amenities are worth a stay. would definitely recommend to go.... every floor is a different wonder, including the cark parking the room is extremely confortable. it's a bit expensive, but you can expect it from a luxury 5* hotel. I suggest to reserve highly in advance to save money (up to 70% off)

Reviews.Title: “Design temple, good service”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: We had a meeting at this hotel, which is new and features international designer themes on each floor. The hotel is on a major express way but noise was not a problem. The hotel is well appointed, the staff are very good and the food is good. Some of the design things are quirky such as my Japanese provincial inspired shower that means it squirts water on the floor if you open the shower door to get in - requires you to hurdle into the shower from the wood bath. The beds were also not so comfortable. Breakfast buffet and catered food was of the highest standard. Meeting facilities top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Passenger86
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, modern and different to all the properties visited so far. The location could be better but you have the underground station a few steps away and it takes you more or less straight to the city centre. The hotel is very different to all the oter hotels in Europe starting from the entrance. Check In experience was very good being able to check the rooms and visit the different floors with an iPad. (Very good considering that in this hotel each floor has been designed by a famous architect or artist and therefore all the floors are completely different). Rooms are just amazing, elegant, alternative, modern..... great views of the mountains surrounding Madrid and all the amenities needed. Prices very reasonable starting from the minibar which normally is very expensive everywhere you go. Large bathrooms and top quality amenities including suede sleepers. Mattresses and linen were just amazing, soft and comfortable. The bar downstairs is very good for a refreshing drink after the whole day shopping and walking around (Champagne Mojito is just awesome!) Service was always very good, with the bellboy explaining everytghing in the room and taking care of everything. Very kind staff at the reception and the bar. Good restaurant with great choice of breakfast. Maybe the hot disses not being recently cooked are the negative point. For the rest, this hotel is definitely one of the best hotels to stay at when visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Cool spot and great service”
Reviews.Author: mickbcm
Reviews.Content: This very modern hotel is a little off the beaten path but well worth the stay. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and the concierge was kind enough to get me excellent tickets to a Real Madrid game. It is well worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous design, but fails on basics such as sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: coopuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October 2010 on business. The fare from Madrid airport to the hotel was 25 Euros. The hotel itself is well situated for Madrid - there is a shopping mall just a few minutes walk away. The hotel itself is a tower block with interesting neon lighting down the side of it - more on that later! There is a taxi rank directly outside it, so transport was never a problem. Checkin was excellent - cheerful and friendly staff, who spoke excellent English. They were able to answer all my questions, and were extremely helpful - when I needed to print off my boarding pass for my return flight, they did it then and there. WELL DONE! This is very much a designer or boutique hotel - the owners have let the designer be very creative with a 2001 science fiction theme. When I got out of the lift on the 8th floor, it was stepping into an episode of UFO, or on to the set of 2001: A Space Odyessy. There was a strange looking sofa outside the lift but! it had a sign on it saying "please do not sit on this." As with so many things with this hotel, it *looks* good, but isn't really practical. The corridors to the rooms follow the same space age design - white, with curved walls - and the doors to the rooms are like airlocks, where you have to out your key to a sensor to open it. The corridors were not very well lit, and to be honest I found them quite eerie. The room itself was very unusual - EVERYTHING was white! Walls, bed, net curtains, chairs... you name it! The layout was very odd - a double bed was bang in the middle of the room, facing the window, so you had to walk round it. There was a very thin work bench with a single chair - this looked good, but was too narrow for any meaningful work to be done on it. Internet access was free - WELL DONE! The bath was right next to the bed (!) and shielded off by a couple of layers of white shower curtains drawn round it. It was an odd shape too - like a large flowerpot, with a shower at one end. Despite its appearances, this did work very well, although water did run easily from it into the rest of the room. The toilet was sealed off by a glass door, although I was slightly bemused at the presence of a phone in there. I ordered room service, which was quickly delivered, and good quality food - WELL DONE! Now on to the bad things. EVERYTHING in the room was white - that means that scuffs and dirt showed up really clearly. There was a storage area (behind another white shower curtain) which was quite badly scuffed and marked - NOT GOOD. The mechanism for using the lights was not clearly outlined - for the first 5 minutes, the lights kept switching off, and I had to run back to the sensor to get them back on. Eventually I managed to lean my room card against it, and that kept them on - NOT GOOD. The bed was very hard, and I didn't enjoy sleeping on it - NOT GOOD. The TV was mounted in the ceiling and lowered via buttons - very dramatic - but the position of it wasn't great - if you wanted to watch TV in bed there was no headrest to give you any support, so you got a crick in your neck. NOT GOOD. The worst part of the room was that it had NO CURTAINS - just thick (white) net sheeting at the window. This meant that when you switched the lights off to go to sleep, any light from outside came straight into the room - and because all the surfaces are white, the light was bounced right round the room. Just to make things worse, my room was directly next to the neon lighting on the outside of the hotel, so my entire room was bathed in a strange amber glow that was bright enough for me read by! I did NOT sleep well - NOT GOOD! Breakfast the next morning was good - an excellent choice of food, and good service. I travel a lot with business and whilst it is very stylish, I simply couldn't recommend it for a business traveler due to the issues with the room layout, lighting and lack of sleep quality. PROS Stylish Good price Good food Free internet access Excellent reception and restaurant staff CONS Dark corridors Style over substance Difficult room lighting Strange and inefficient room layout Hard beds No way to control/restrict external light Poor sleep quality

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jeffreyevan
Reviews.Content: The hotel Puerta America is a really exclusive luxury Hotel in Madrid. We stayed this hotel 3 nights and considered the hotel was beautiful and flawlessly centered for both work and tourist undertakings 15 min cab travel to/from the airport, 3 minute walk to the shopping center (loved the metro!) and/or a 10 min cab travel downtown. As you will read in other reconsiders of the hotel, each floor was conceived by a distinct architect and has a absolutely exclusive layout and feel. My room was established on the second floor, conceived by Norman Foster, in an ultra-modern white cowhide and stainless iron alloy motif. (The partitions were white, padded cowhide - got rather a joke about getting put in the padded room.) The hotel staff are all bilingual, so my very negligible Spanish was not a hindrance. The concierge table was cooperative designing tourist trips, aiding with journey arrangements and making evening meal reservations. They suggested bistros both inside and out-of-doors the hotel and all were rather good, particularly the MAD bistro (in the hotel) and Chat flan, a 10 min cab travel away.Only 2 negatives: First, the morning meal buffet was magnificent, but at 35 Euros per individual ($52 US) was awfully overpriced. Second, the hallway carpeting on my floor was awfully stained and frayed; decisively out of location in such a high-quality hotel. All things advised, it was a magnificent, exclusive location to stay, and a large alternate to downtown hotels.Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: NLBanker
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay in this hotel. At check-in you can choose between a dozen or so designer-rooms: great fun! Excellent amenities. The location is somewhat out of the centre, but the Metro is close and the hotel can be easilly reached in under 15 minutes form the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Zaha Hadid room worth the price, including the cool bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: mrodri81
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner in the Puerta America hotel on September. The experience was incredible. We chose the Zaha Hadid room and it was amazing. It was like being in a movie. Very spacious and comfortable room. The hotel staff was friendly and ready to help with everything, except on the bar. The waiters here were not very helpful. It is a pricy hotel, but for a treat is lovely. Location wise, it is a bit farther away from the city centre, but the public transport is good. We did a tour around the hotel as well, to see the rest of the design. Definately worth going.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was a tourist attraction in it's own right”
Reviews.Author: Sunnynzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a twin room on the 9th floor that was designed by Richard Gluckman. The room was lovely, although perhaps not great for bathroom privacy if you're travelling with friends. We enjoyed admiring the design aspects of the hotel. We made the most of the rooftop pool and gym and complimentary drinks at the bar, but avoided the pricey restaurant. On the weekends the ground floor bar and rooftop club seems to be a happening place, but with great sound proofing we weren't disturbed in our room. Probably the only annoyance was the noice that came in from the lobby/hallway. The entrance door didn't seem to have great noise insulation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with amazing design but not central”
Reviews.Author: Hickory8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Silken Puerta America for two nights with my girlfriend. Each of the hotel’s twelve storeys is designed in a unique style by a different designer or architect. During check-in at the hotel you will be presented with a folder that shows the style of the rooms on each floor and you can choose the floor which you like best (some of the floors will have a higher room rate). We chose the second floor designed by Norman Foster. On this floor the walls are “tiled” with white leather and the rooms are furnished with modern design classics. One side of the room has an illumated sideboard of translucent marble along the whole length of the room. It functions as desk on one end of the room and holds the sinks in the bathroom on the other end. The bathroom is open plan, so it might not be suitable for non-couples (toilet has a door though). There is a big bed, a cupboard and a safe. Light can be dimmed to four different ambiances, and there is a control for airco as well as for electric blinds for the big window. The hotel also offers a pool, steamroom and gym. We didn’t try any of the restaurants (breakfast was quite expensive) or bars in the hotel. The roof terrace bar is apparently very good though (unfortunately we didn’t have terrace weather). The location of the hotel is not optimal: it takes about 15 mins by taxi to the city center (~20 EUR) or a metro ride of about 25 mins (station is a few hundred meters away). Service and cleanliness where impeccable. All in all this is a great hotel with good service, nice rooms and amazing design the only catch being the location outside the city center.

Reviews.Title: “The starchitects' design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shinito
Reviews.Content: It is important to know which design you are comfortable with as each floor has different design by different architect/designer. Tips: I have moved from Plasma Studio, Zaha Hadid to Ron Arad within my stay. I will explain why in a bit. I would recommend Ron Aron (white). Why Ron Arad instead of Plasma Studio or Zaha Hadid? Arad's room has the most creative and unusual layout ever as all furniture and utilities are designed as A PIECE being placed in the middle of the room but it is surprisingly practical and comfortable. The round-shaped bed is huge and the remote-controlled projection screen turns the room into some sort of funky home-theater-like space. Intelligent/Smart system embedded. Huge bathtub and nice shower. The design itself is the joy of living in this room. I almost kill myself in Plasma Studio's room because of all the sharp edges even though I have to admit Plasma Studio has provided the most visually stimulating design for the hotel but it is best to keep it as installation. Whereby Hadid's room is again another installation-like space and you just need to watch out every move within the room. *HIGHLY RECOMMENDED: (even you are not staying in this hotel) Dine in the Michelin-starred restaurant on ground level, MUST NOT MISS the Cochinillo Asado (Roast Suckling Pig) here! It is the best in Madrid indeed! The restaurant's decorated with with leather and rich woods, providing a cozy, meticulously lit space for dining experience but it is the top-notch service and foods to die for!

Reviews.Title: “If you love design and architecture, you will love this. I sure did.”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: Totally brilliant, right up my alley. Were this hotel located in the heart of Madrid it would probably be #1 on the Tripadvisor list, so maybe it's just as well. You pretty much need to take a cab here from the airport, but once here, it is easy to take the subway into the city. It's pretty much all been said, but I really was dazzled by the different themes and looks on each floor. As to people who have said it can be a little intimidating to stay here if you aren't gorgeous and 25 years old, I can sort of see that. It was party central when we were staying here with the entire outdoor restaurant taken over by a group of fabulous looking 20-somethings, but I personally thought it was fun to have them around. The restaurant was delicious for dinner, and the atmosphere brilliant. We had one sort of strange ham thing that we couldn't chew, but I am giving that a pass for some reason because it was otherwise a great experience and fun, fun hotel. I will definitely stay here again. We were on floor 7, the Ron Arad rooms. Loved, loved, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Astounding design - even if you don't stay here, visit it while you're in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: rumfucius
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silken Puerta America as part of our visit to Madrid during New Year 2010. The hotel is pretty unique in that each floor is designed by a different designer and the rooms reflect the theme for each floor. We were on the 10th floor which was designed by a Japanese designer Isozaki and our room was lovely with a great view of the city of Madrid. We visited each floor of the hotel and I highly recommend that anyone staying at the hotel do that. It's very interesting to see the different floors and the different designers and the imagination they have brought to the different floors. One floor for instance had a spaceship theme and all the rooms were designed like spaceships. The top floor with the bar and the walkway with the glass floor is also pretty cool. The view from there was astounding. There's a fitness centre on the top floor with a heated pool so we could swim even in December, so that was pretty nice as well. The only downside of this hotel is that the location is a bit out of the main part of the city, but it is about 200m from a subway station so getting around isn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Totally architecture!”
Reviews.Author: valeturca
Reviews.Content: Great architectural and design hotel. All the building has an architectural atmosphere. It's like a museum of architecture! Amazing! Metro: use the orange line and red one, good combination to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting concept, poorly executed”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_23_London
Reviews.Content: The idea that each floor is decorated by a different designer is interesting, but in reality the hotel veers towards the pretentious. I can live with the fact that I hated my room decorated in blue plastic with irridescent curtains - that is a matter of personal taste. But the finish in the room was far from 5*. Nothing was well fitted (surely a must with a very minimalist look?) and the chips, stains, cracked glass, etc made it feel poorly maintained. I always though that design was the product of form plus function. Well the designer of my room forgot the function bit. Having to crawl on the floor to locate the hidden power point under the bed is not my idea of fun. The wardrobe with hanging space only 70cm high is totally impractical - where is a woman supposed to hang a dress? And don't expect to be able to iron any clothes creased in your luggage as the hotel is unable to make irons available, and the ironing service takes 24h - so no use for the overnight guest. Location on a busy dual carriageway does not help, and service very patchy too. The one saving grace was that the bed was very comfortable, but all in all I was underwhelmed and would not recommend it. There are plenty of more comfortable hotels in better locations in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Huge mistake”
Reviews.Author: Kevlange
Reviews.Content: Wow. And wow again. I didn’t think that Tripadvisor’s reviewers could fail so miserably. All those superlatives for no reason. This hotel has no personality what so ever despite all individuality. The design is really bad. Design and function should go hand in hand, especially in a luxury hotel. And it actually feel a little bit worn already. My advise - do not stay here, just get here for a quick visit if you are really curious about it, there are plenty of stylish and more comfy hotels in the city center (I can really recommend the ME Reina Victoria at Plaza Santa Ana).

Reviews.Title: “made a huge impression---service, rooms, decor, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_2008
Reviews.Content: My wife has just stayed with the Silken Puerta America and she mentioned it was fantastic. Service was impressive and the design of the hotel like nothing else she has seen. Bed and shower were fabulous! Restaurants in the hotel were modern and sleek---food matched the 5 stars of the hotel....overall worth several trips back to this hotel that is like a modern art museum.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the wow factor"”
Reviews.Author: herodan
Reviews.Content: If youre looking for a bargain then look for somewhere else to stay. The Hotel exudes "cool" so dont expect the usual creature comforts you'd get in another five star with shag pile carpets and mountains of free soap and shampoo. You pay for the design and thats about it. The basic price the hotel charges is for the "deluxe" room, which is the basic one. They charge more to change rooms and then charge again to upgrade to a suite, which is what most people would expect. That said, we stayed in the Japanese designed room which looked awesum. It's not supposed to be functional, just stylish. You walk in an dont want to touch anything in case you ruin the look. The hotel staff were initially typically surly spanish, but were friendly enough when you wanted something, the reception staff were particularly helpful with maps and metro details. The Hotel is about a five minute walk from Avenida De America Metro which has connections to all the other metro stations, including the airport. You can catch the 200 bus from the airport which is 2 euros (turn right when you leave the airport and walk hundred metres along the concourse). Of course, if youre spending this much on a hotel then you'd probably get a cab which cost us 25 euros one way. The hotel facilities are NOT functional but again are installed for style. The pool is not for swimming in but looks great and in the summer is open air. Its more of a plunge pool but it was never designed to accomodate screaming kids and blow up whales. The bar is expensive but offers good cocktails and great views of the city. The Metro is cheap and easy to work out and gets you to all the main tourist destinations quickly. If you go clubbing like we did, a taxi back costs in the region of 10-15 euros from central Madrid - a tip - unless you speak fluent spanish show the driver the room card which has the hotel postcode - they all use SatNav and have no idea where you are asking them to take you! All in all this is a special hotel and is made special by its design and attention to detail. If its something special you are looking for then this is it. If you need a luxury base in Madrid with the same old bored hotel room interior then spend your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: snow_whiteGB
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this site and seen the website I was excited about this hotel. However, I ended up being pretty disappointed and can think of few good things to say about the hotel. The hotel is not in a good location and there's nothing to do in the vicinity. However, the metro system is pretty efficient and we thought the other features of the hotel would make up for this. We were wrong. Obviously the main point of the hotel is to experience the impressive rooms so we looked through the room 'menu' and chose some exciting rooms. Unfortunately, we were told if we wanted to stay in the rooms we chose we would have to pay a supplement. Perhaps this is my fault for not checking the website properly but it was certainly not clear at the time of booking (we booked through lastminute). Anyway, rather than pay even more, we settled for a room on the 6th floor which did not carry an additional charge. Other than the fact that the wall between the bathroom and the bedroom could be removed, the room was nothing special. For our second night, we asked if we could move rooms. Again the main point of this hotel is to experience the rooms, so we wanted experience more than one. Guess what though... 60 Euro supplement, just to change rooms. And then it would be even more if we wanted one of the rooms with additional charges. I thought this was pretty poor. The hotel is not cheap, as it is, and they are still trying to add charges, wherever they can. Some other points to note: The pool is tiny, dark and cold. There is nowhere to change and nowhere to store belongings while you are in the gym/ pool. This facility is just for show as I can't see anyone using it. The entrance to the hotel is not clear and does not make it seem inviting. Finally, most of the staff were pretty cold and unhelpful. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone unless they are willing to pay a lot of money to stay in a variety of rooms. Even then I don't know if it would be worth it as I didn't get to see those other rooms. Don't stay in this pretentious hotel. There are plenty of lovely hotels in the centre of Madrid (which is a wonderful city).

Reviews.Title: “Surprise !”
Reviews.Author: as3006
Reviews.Content: Over priced but amazing

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MyleneKern
Reviews.Content: excellent service, superb breakfast buffet. close to metro station and to many good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Astounding!”
Reviews.Author: yujeen
Reviews.Content: Simply out of this world.Stayed at Zaha Hadid's room and felt like a fetus in a womb.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely design”
Reviews.Author: DVG59
Reviews.Content: and good service. Location is 'ok', at the location itself there is not much to do, but you can take the metro to the Puerto del Sol, takes 5 minutes walking. Loved the "japanese" floor. Wooden bathtub, all black and white, with eye for detail. Even the toiletpaper was black! Great bar on the top floor too, with serious sized caiperina! Good breakfast, with quality food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing design, great rooms, good restaurant and pool”
Reviews.Author: Fleur H
Reviews.Content: The design of this hotel is not to be missed! It's a unique five star hotel and definitely worth a look! When I arrived I was handed a large folder with photographs and descriptions about each floor. Each floor of the hotel has been created by a different designer, so each one is amazingly different. I was told I could choose a floor and a room...So I looked through and weighed up my options of futuristic, minimalist, Japanese-inspired etc. I went for the latter...All black interiors (even the toilet roll!) and an eastern feel looking out to the city. The bathroom was amazing...the room wasn't huge but it was fine for what I needed. The lap pool is lovely and was refreshing and quiet. The restaurant serves good food and wasn't a rip-off! Do go later though...I felt very English arriving so early and was the only patron to begin with. All staff were helpful and friendly - if there are two of you, just order one room service meal for breakfast - A loophole I found worked as there was so much food and for room service it really was at a good price! The only down side to the property was it's location - Nothing really around it in that area - I did find a small shop to stock up on a few grocery items, but you have to get the metro into the centre of Madrid. The location s brilliant for the airport though - so if you are doing a stopover and want to treat yourself then definitely do! It's a sure hot spot: The Madrid football team stay there :-)

Reviews.Title: “Impressive design - but that's where it ends!”
Reviews.Author: mexo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the novelty of the differently designed floors and the attraction of the various architects / designers. After a 27€ cab ride from the airport, we were first booked into a Norman Foster room which was very nice - all glass and marble, but 2nd floor at the back so a disappointing view. It also only had a shower and we prefer a bath, so we asked to move and they were very accommodating, putting us on the 6th floor in a Marc Newson room. This was full of high gloss surfaces, grey leather and wood, with a nice big bathtub and a wall that folded away so you could make the bath become part of the bedroom. The public areas on each floor were also impressive, particularly the Zaha Hadid. (There is apparently a tour of the hotel that we would have liked to take, but no one told us about it.) However this is where it ended as far as a good impression goes and for the following reasons I would not recommend the hotel and would not return. My husband and I are in our fifties but perfectly presentable, neither badly dressed nor hideous and our kids allow us out. However there was a distinct air of scorn from the painfully fashionable, younger staff and other clients (not necessarily residents) when we dared to set foot in the bar and pool areas. The rooftop bar is hugely expensive. For 30€ a cocktail I would expect them to know how to make a dry martini. My husband had to go and show them after we had waited half an hour and then they arrived completely wrong. (We were erroneously charged for mineral water and champagne, however, after complaining at check out, these drinks as well as the doomed martinis, were removed from our bill.) If you don't manage to bag a sought-after tall stool next to the window with the sky view, you are relegated to sagging pouffes which are roughly 1 foot from the ground. You can therefore see nothing but the knees of the gorgeous, but surly, waitresses as they flounce by and you should allow a good five minutes to be able to get up again. The walls and ceiling are of flapping plastic so the feeling is one of being in a very noisy marquee at a wedding at which no one is speaking to you. The music is unrelentingly deafening Europop - rather than sultry & atmospheric Buddha Bar. We had a very nice dinner in the smaller restaurant, as the "gourmet" one was closed on Sunday nights, that menu being very interesting, but also hugely expensive. We ate foie gras, mushroom risotto, tuna tartare and a perfect little hamburger, followed by balsamic-marinated strawberries with cheese ice-cream. It was delicious. The rooftop floor also houses the pool, which, on first visit is very confusing. You exit the lift , thinking, as in a bad dream, that you have just walked into the bar in your bathrobe. However, a girl whose job it is to usher confused guests into the spa, rushes out from her post to usher confused guests into the spa. This also causes much smirking and derision from all supercilious onlookers. The pool is dark and somewhat gloomy with only 4 beds around it. The steam room and showers are nice. The weather was gorgeous and a rooftop terrace or balcony would make this area much more appealing. In fact, having come from an exhausting day in Madrid one afternoon and just wishing to relax in the sun for a while, we were reduced to lying on the grass verge alongside the 3 lane highway outside the hotel, surrounded by dog mess! We have just returned from a 5* resort in Mauritius and I know that, had they seen 2 guests wandering around obviously looking for somewhere to sunbathe, they would have run out proffering sun beds and drinks. The staff here just stood and looked bemused. The lift is programmed not to stop at guest rooms at certain times to accommodate the non-resident bar customers, who all come to spend their free drink tokens. This information is kept a mystery to guests however, who can regularly be witnessed frantically waving their room key in front of the light in an attempt to exit the lift at their floor. Sadly all to no avail. This, of course, causes further amusement and is probably put in place to enhance the evening of, the aforesaid stylista clientele. The location is half way between the airport and the centre of Madrid. It is not a particularly appealing area. When we first checked in, the hotel lift was full of local kids joy riding. This did not say much for the security - who were probably too preoccupied with their reflection in the glass doors to notice. There is a Metro 5 minutes walk away and the train system is very efficient and cheap. However it does become wearing when you are out all day and then return for a bath and to get dressed up for dinner, knowing that you have to face the journey twice more that evening. I would recommend very comfortable shoes. The Metro to the airport is 2€ per person and easy. We did have a great time - Madrid is wonderful - and a sense of humour as well as reasonably robust self images saw us through at the hotel. I get the feeling that if you wish to go and experience it for yourselves, you should make it reasonably soon. Just go on a diet first, adopt a sneer, wear black and you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “British Guide to this hotel - the way to do it in Madrid FOR SURE !”
Reviews.Author: Dinkystar
Reviews.Content: Everything they say about this hotel on their website is what you get, no need to mention anything about the rooms or design of the place other than if you don't like it you will never be pleased anywhere in the world. Now there are two ways of doing things in this hotel, go for it or use the rest of Madrid to eat and drink. It's five star all the way and it's prices reflect that. The deluxe rooms( like ours on floor 6 ) are shown as 840 Euro's per night in the hotel room guide and there is no doubt the Spanish elite pay that and the 12 - 14 Euros for a long drink and the 25 Euros for a full English breakfast if they like our food if not our style! It was full of Spanish suited and booted and my fiance and I paid £360 for a three night stay including flights and taxes from good old Luton Airport ! Checking bang in at 2pm and out at 12pm with a night flight home! Last minute dot com we thank you and for a change Easy Jet !! It was a romantic break as well as taking in Chelsea's game against Athletico Madrid and worth every penny, a real pukka place !!! For the record the hotel is not that far out from the Centre of Madrid and the metro system is simple to understand, miles more efficient and cleaner than the London Underground and as cheap as peanuts. Be careful of pregnant ladies decoying for pickpockets though. The cab from the Airport is 25 Euros, others who stayed in and around Sol paid 35 Euros, but the Metro runs every 3 mins and it costs 1 Euro from the Airport and 2 Euros including Airport supplement going back! Open from 600 am to 2330 pm the metro to and from the Airport is a massive saving for travelling on a budget even in this splendour! Otherwise the Metro Link is open until 200 am, the stop at Cartagena is a stones throw from the hotel on Line 7 the Orange colour one! To get into the Centre of Madrid the stop is Sol on Line 2 the red coloured one!! They also have nightbuses a la London. Basically it's 1 Euro on the metro until you get off. Simple and efficient ,pay at outset and you walk out at your destination. Or you can get a ten journey trip, ten outs we called it and it cost just over 7 euros. To be honest we never bothered with this for when you get to Sol everything is walkable - Madrids centre is ultra small. From this hotel to Sol it's like stopping at Earls Court to get to Piccadily. Same time but a shorter distance. It's also closer than Sol for Real Madrid's ground, bear this in mind for the Champions League Final Chelsea fans!!! Santiago Bernabeu on Line 9 the purple one is bang outside the ground. For Athletico Madrid the stop is Puerto de Toledo, south and therefore closer to Sol. We walked it from Plaza Mayor a fantastic little square with Covent Garden type acts and restaraunts. Stopping on the way at a pub at De Toledo and later with a thousand or so Chelsea fans an old fashioned type police escort to the ground! Madrid is a lovely place and for £1.99 at Luton Airport we got the Eyewitness Travel Madrid Pocket Map and Guide it was fantastic for Area's to visit and Restaraunts and Bars. We had a great time and all our meals were spot on, although the price of the Euro makes it rather expensive at the moment, clothes and perfume a definate no no. The Irish Bar on corner of the Plaza Mayor has to be recommended for it's live football and decent pub grub. The barman like the majority of working class in Madrid support Athletico, all Reals fans are upper class or come from away and abroad to support them a bit like Manchester in that respect! One gripe with Spanish waiters and this hotel is no exception with regard to Customer service - Why do us Brits have to ask for everything? Clicking fingers may be the Spanish style guys but we prefer to be asked, surely that's etiquiete - there i'm not sure if i've spelt it right! Throw in a free spa, gym and turkish bath .... I would recommend this hotel to my mum - that means it's as good as you will get.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCrown
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a reccomendation.... Utterly fabulous, I won't go on about the design, it has all been said. The main restaurant was absolutely first class, inspired menu, superb service... and.... I could relax with a nice cigar afterwards, like one could always do before the world went mad. Great staff.... all round faultless stay and I'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Architectural Brilliance - Comes with some Impracticalities”
Reviews.Author: urbanmtngirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Silken Puerta America Madrid is, by far, the most unique architectural concept hotel I have experienced. Each floor has been designed by a different world-renowned architect, each with a very different design aesthetic, including the all-white star trek/space age approach of Kathryn Findlay, Jean Nouvel's sexy Asian motif, starkly minimalist Zaha Hadid, to the metallic optical illusion of the "Plasma Studio" floor (my choice... see the pics). When you check in, if you haven't requested a particular floor, you are told which rooms are still available and given the hotel lookbook to thumb through, in order to help you make your selection. The whole thing lends an air of excited anticipation... what will the room look like? Did I choose the "best one?" (My imagination wandered to how other hotels utilize the "theme room" concept, yet the Silken Puerta America, while dripping sensuality at every opportunity, doesn't even come close to the tawdry ...or banal.) As the outside-facing glass elevator doors opened onto the all-metal, sharp cornered, illusory "Plasma Studio" floor my jaw dropped. I felt a bit like I was in the hall of mirrors from that James Bond film. The room was no less exciting; it was entirely metal and glass, futuristic, gleaming, and uber-sexy. The designer apparently thought sex appeal would be heightened by including a completely transparent "wall" between the bathroom and the bedroom. That's right, the bathroom was encased only in glass, which did not become opaque when the door shut (as some do), nor when you turn on water, though the steam effect helps somewhat. I would suggest staying in this room solo, or else ensuring you're VERY comfortable with your partner... it's romantic, but if you're still into preserving that "air of mystery" this room will dispel it. Onto practicalities: the shower leaked, the bathroom flooded, and generally was a total mess. The management ended up moving me to another (far superior) room on one of the top floors, the Mariscal y Salas floor, which, though it looked as though it was a combination of African tribal motifs and 80s pop-art, ended up being a stunning, comfortable room. The room had a panoramic view of all of Madrid, of which the lights, viewed at night when laying in bed, were absolutely incredible. The bathroom was enormous, and the shower was an ultra-luxe, super-deep tub with about eight different shower heads and jets. The management was so apologetic about the first room, they included a fresh fruit basket, a bottle of wine and a personal note of apology awaiting me in the new room. Though this hotel is located quite far from the center of Madrid (about 20 minutes by cab and probably about 10-15 euros), it's very close to the airport; so convenience is relative. The hotel restaurant was amazing. The food was some of the best I'd had in Madrid; not being terribly impressed with the tapas and typical Spanish food I had eaten around the rest of the city. The rooftop bar is very cool with a sexy red vibe, great views of the city, and some really fun bartenders. I would recommend this hotel if I had a one or two night stopover in Madrid and didn't have a need to go outside the hotel... there is plenty enough to entertain you here, provided you appreciate a certain aesthetic.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service & basking in former glory”
Reviews.Author: adkarle
Reviews.Content: Location - twenty minutes from the centre of Madrid. Quite a working class zone. I imagine this hotel was great about five years ago. Due to poor maintenance it is showing its age. Reception staff at check-in attempt a hard sell on room upgrades. The desperation is quite sad to see. Housekeeping provides a poor service. Complaints to aloof management prove fruitless. Who ever allocated the five stars at the front of the hotel appears to have either not reviewed recently, or was a little over zealous with allocation. As design hotels go, this establishment is undortunately leagues behind.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, good quality hotel but a shame the food/cocktails are so expensive”
Reviews.Author: CheckingOut
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as it looked interesting and because it was very reasonably priced as part of hotel/flight August bank holiday deal. As other reviewers have mentioned and as you can see on the website each floor has a very different character as its designed by a different architect. We stayed on the Foster floor in the most basic room but it was a very decent size and well fitted out with crisp natural materials and colours so very relaxing. The shower was a multifunction power shower but be warned it is open to the room and the toilet has a frosted glass door - the rooms definitely aren't for the shy! The swimming pool is on the top floor and has an unusual metal finish but it is quite small and felt crowded with 4 people swimming in it - also be careful as the wooden decking around the pool gets really slippery when wet! There is also a steam room, some spa type showers and a small fitness room (treadmill, bike, weights etc). Breadkfast wasn't included in package and we didn't add it on as extra as it was prohibitively expensive. Likewise as much as the bars looked fab for an evening we didn't try them out as the drinks prices were extortionate. Location isn't bad, its a bit out of the way but well connected by the metro, which is clean, cheap and punctual.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning - But Not Very Practical!”
Reviews.Author: Patti1958
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely has the "Wow" factor! The multi co loured facade is very eye catching and the interior even more so. You have to visit every floor to appreciate the stunning interior design, as no two are alike. The glass floor on the 13th, where you can look down between your feet and see the terrace far below, is unnerving yet strangely compelling! Likewise the glass elevators that climb the outside of the building, providing panoramic views across the motorway. Our room, on the Norman Foster floor, was swish and stylish. However, when actually living there a few problems became apparent. There was very little storage space - no where to put suitcases and no drawers, just a closet. We used the indoor pool - small but very attractive and well appointed - but had nowhere to dry our swimsuits. The shower and toilet, which look amazing, offer very little privacy to the user. Robes, slippers and toiletries were provided, but what we would have really appreciated were tea and coffee making facilities. The bar and restaurant prices were extremely high, and room service prices were unbelievable! This meant eating out all the time. That wasn't a problem as we found some nice restaurants in the vicinity, but sometimes it would have been nice to just wander downstairs for an affordable breakfast or a coffee. Some reviews have complained about the location of the hotel, but as the Metro is so close and so efficient we did not find this a problem. It may be a problem if you want to go into the town at night. All of the staff we came into contact with were extremely helpful and efficient. All in all, staying at this hotel is an experience well worth having, and I'm very glad that we did, but to enjoy it to the full you need plenty of money!

Reviews.Title: “Really Trendy and Unique”
Reviews.Author: WomblesofWimbledon
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Madrid – 1 night at Silken Puerto and 2 nights at the Room Mates Mario. We picked the Silken because of the reviews we read, but the icing on the cake was the price was good as well. Just under €100 for the night. A bargain! As everyone says, the location is slightly out, but the Madrid Metro is very easy to navigate – and it’s really a couple of mins from the Metro Station. We stayed on the 9th floor Rooms are big, very trendy. The pool was tiny, not really worth going to. But we ate at the restaurant and that was really great even though it was a little pricey – would certainly recommend eating here. My recommendation is that you should stay here one or two nights – it’s different, but do as we did, spend a night or two in the centre of Madrid as well, it where all the actions is (see separate review of the Room Mates Mario).

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Room/Hotel, Expensive Food/Drink and a bit Out of Town”
Reviews.Author: The_boys_Norwich
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights here in a standard room on floor 8. Had a choice of a few floors when we checked in. Impressed with the room - nice big bathroom and powerful shower. Big window - and black out blinds - but no balcony access. Huge comfy bed, with crisp white cotton bed linen and choice of pillows. The breakfast was included in the rate and was good, not excellent but not bad. A choice of hot and cold and different juices.teas/coffees. But in my view only worth 15 euros each. Didn't use the pool area, quite small and dark. Location wise you have to catch a taxi or use the metro to get the the centre/sights - we used he metro every day in and out - which was a bit of a hassle - but not terrible - took about 30 mins and at least 1 change each way. As the hotel is out of the centre it was really quiet at night - didn't hear a peep! Food and drinks at the hotel are v expensive - 1 G&T 13 euro's! All in all a great hotel which totally served it's purpose - with a funky different style. And good value if you get a good room rate that includes breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very different...”
Reviews.Author: Adman-lex
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of weeks here just before Christmas on business, really funky place to stay. Not cheap but certainly very individual with different deocr on each floor to suit your tastes. Our party stayed on various floors and found them all to be fun and nice to stay in. Only downside was level 10 with the black bathroom when one of our team nearly broke his toe in the black bathroom, he couldn't see the edge so hence the injury. Food is good and the general atmosphere is geared to design savvy individuals...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Probus
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter (13) and I stayed at the Puerta America at the end of July. As a number of reviews have pointed out, it is a bit away from the main sites but there are two Metro lines nearby which we used extensively - much cleaner and cheaper than London. We were offered a wide choice of floors and opted for the 10th (Japanese style). Both rooms were of reasonable size - probably a bit smaller than I would have expected - but were well-designed, spotlessly clean and, given the temperature outside (high 30s), the air conditioning was superb. All the staff we encountered were very pleasant and most spoke excellent English - unlike some "designer/boutique" hotels they seemed genuinely interested in the guest rather than simply standing around looking cool. The breakfast buffet was exceptional and provided enough food to keep us going till late afternoon. We dined in the hotel twice - the first evening in the outside terrace restaurant where the food and ambience were excellent; on the second night we had "tapas" in the main restaurant - again, the food and service were of high quality but we felt it was less good value. We also had drinks in the outside bar and sky bar. Prices are comparable with a five star hotel in London but the quantities of spirit much greater - my vodka & tonic lasted me about an hour and a half! The hotel seems to attract lots of young, glamorous madrilenos and this added to the vibe. I would certainly stay here aqain.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel by day, swingers hotel by night”
Reviews.Author: officially_mh
Reviews.Content: The night me and my boyfriiend arrived at the hotel we received a great welcome - the concierge opened the taxi doors for you, took your bags, the receptionist was lovely and the hotel itself certainly looked, and felt like a 5* hotel. However, it soon became clear that we were somewhat under dressed for many evening occasions. As the title suggests it's more of a business hotel by day and a swingers hotel by night so be prepared. Maybe take some clothes which you can dress up if you plan on going up to the bar on the 13th floor. Speaking of the 13th floor, the view from the dome is fab (barring in mind that you're not scared of heights or walking on the glass which allows you to see all the way down onto the motorway). And that's another thing, the hotel is in the middle of a motorway (half way between the Barajas Airport and the town centre) which is a little inconvenient as it's not a walking distance to anywhere. The taxis can quite easily charge you up to 15 euros into town and up to 25 euros to and from the airport. However, there is a metro nearby...although we didn't attempt at using it. The taxi drivers in particular either know where the hotel is situated and refer to it as "that ugly building" (which we found to be quite funny) or don't, so do write down the name of the road before you leave the hotel. Yet the rooms did make up for the poor location. Of course, you get to choose your own room and the design of every floor is different which is quite cool. The breakfast is also great but the only other down side is the cost of the food. The mini bar is overly expensive and so are their other menus but it is 5* hotel afterall. The indoor pool, the sauna and the gym are okay but some may find the facilities to be a bit small. Other than that it was an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjl2178
Reviews.Content: This was a really cool place. We traveled with about 5 couples and it was fun just to go to all the other rooms and see how they all differ. The staff was nice. Rooms were clean. We had a nice stay. If you are in Madrid for sightseeing then this hotel is a little ways from all the major sights. The Metro in Madrid is very easy to navigate though. We had a great time in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “funky design”
Reviews.Author: roby73
Reviews.Content: this hotel is one of a kind for the design element. I am an architect so I decided to splush for 2 night here while in madrid. It's really fun and it's a "must" if design is your thing, but has very unpractical rooms and consider one can only see one of the 12 different types. The extras in the room are not much apart from bathrobe and sleepers...minibar is super expensive and room are not very spacious. I stayed at AC avenida america in Madrid for only 70euros at night and it's a lot better and a lot better value for money!

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: Dorrra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very unusual and beautiful! We could only choose a room from three different floors, so we coldn't get the one we really wanted. The room was amazing anyway! I expected it to be a bit bigger, but when you opened the WALL to the bathroom it got much bigger! The bathroom was clean with both a bathtub and shower (although shower doors were not watertight!) Staff was helpful, brakfast great and a roof bar with a pool and sauna just amazing. The only inconvenience was a location. The hotel is not very far from the metro station, but you need to change a train at least once to get to the city centre. Watch out for the taxi drivers! We took a taxi one at night from the city and it should cost approx. 10-12 euro, but the taxi driver took us to a different hotel and when we got to ours we had to pay for his mistake! My Spanish wasn't good enough to fight so I gave it up. I could at least try... I wish I did. It's not about money itself - it was something that shouldn't take place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the spirit of modern design”
Reviews.Author: Stefan-go
Reviews.Content: 11 floors, each designed from an other outstanding designer. I've been in the hotel in May for the 4th time, each time an other exciting floor and very differently designed room. I love them all! The hotel is located perfectly between the airport and down-town directly at the huge Avenida de America - but due to the perfectly soundprooved windows it is really quiet in the rooms. Enjoy the amazing view from the bar on the top - it is really great! And ask the consierge to accompany to your room when you visit the hotel for the first time: switching on and off the light is not an easy thing ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Wacky, unique but easy to find faults”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAlli
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights on floor 7--all the walls are curved and everything is in black and red. Bed is circular but nicely firm. Hard to get ready when all your mirrors make you look like you are in a funhouse... I purposely wanted to stay here based on what I had learned from travel articles and other research and I will say the property in theory did not dissappoint. Loved the concept of the different "far out" designs, just wished the implementation was of better quality. Enjoyed riding the elevator and getting off on different floors just to take in the different designs. Biggest beef was the noise on floor 7--the halls and rooms have hard floors and I am convinced housekeeping had some sort of vendetta against me since both mornings staff felt the need to camp out right in front of my room and be really really loud--banging, loud talking, etc. Location is not tragic but not necessarily convenient. Metro close but most major sights are at least two transfers away. After a long day of sightseeing, one is not always excited to make another 45 minute trip back to the old town for nightlife. Top floor bar not open. Lobby bar crowded and staff not that friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Design above all”
Reviews.Author: OlaLazar
Reviews.Content: One thing is sure - I have never seen anything like it before. This hotel is like a temple of design, the followers of the religion just need to adapt to the inconviniencies of the place. As for me the hotel doesn't deserve the 5 stars deluxe rating for it's service, comfort or food, but it certainly does for the "wow factor".

Reviews.Title: “Excellant experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Vicstar28
Reviews.Content: Went to Madrid on 27th - 30th Dec. The hotel amazin, we had the choice of 3 floors and we stayed on the 9th - lovely! Be aware not to set your heart on the top floor (12th) as this is the executive suites and to upgrade is 750 euros per night minimum! Lobby staff helpful, hotel spotless and in the bathroom all toiletries provided including ear buds, pads, comb, razor, toothbrush, soaps, shampoos etc and replaced daily. Our room had no balcony so when opting for a non-smoking room there was no chance to nip out to the balcony without going downstairs to the bar. We steered clear of the mini bar as it was over priced and they turned a blind eye to us bringing in water and snacks. PLEASE DONT be put off by reviews that state the location lets it down as this panicked me when i booked but in fact it is perfect if you dont want to be in the centre of the hustle and bustle. There is a bus stop outside the hotel and the metro station is 5 minutes away, if you walk 5 more minutes you reach the main metro and bus station. There are bars and resturants in the area and we personally liked the Irish bar as it had a friendly atmosphere. From the airport we caught a bus (No 200) from outside and paid 1 euro each to get to the bus station which is 2 stops and only a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Metro is very user friendly, we got a map from the hotel and all ticket machines have English on them so easy to use. We paid 7 euros for a pass that enables you to have 10 trips, this lasted us for 2 days as you only put ticket in at one end of the journey. Madrid was spectacular as they had a Xmas market, Xmas lights and lots of acts randomly dotted about to entertain you. We got a funny portrait done - negotiate the price if you want a joint one we did! Good bar found called Tijcana, very friendly and food good. They also have Scrabble, English newspaper, dominos etc so you can easily pass time away if your feet need a rest! Went to the Real Madrid Stadium, well worth a visit, access to all areas and well worth the money and queue. Overall had a smashing 3 days and would recommend to anyone! Email me if you need to know anything else.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not sure”
Reviews.Author: MissTUk
Reviews.Content: I'm really not sure how I feel about this hotel. I was expecting something amazing due to having read up about it and seen the pictures. We found the car park ok and were given a choice of floors 3, 4 or 11 due to wanting a smoking room. This was a bit disappointing as i'd been keen to stay on a different floor but the reasons are understandable so we picked floor 3, which was my husband's favourite. The room was large and comfortable with a huge bed and the bathroom was lovely with a huge, powerful shower. It was a lovely room but maybe not as spectacular as i'd been expecting. I also thought that it was spoilt by the view of the ring road. Not much point having ceiling to floor windows if the view isn't great. We found the staff polite and friendly and always willing to help. The prices in the hotel were worse than usual due to the value of the pound against the euro. We paid 14 euro for two halves of lager in the downstairs bar. The room service prices are also very high although we did get free any non alcoholic drinks and crisps/chocolate in the mini bar. We also got a free film per day which would usually have been 16 euro. There wasn't that much around open as we stayed Sun - Tue so we struggled to find somewhere to eat and ordered room service instead. A taxi cost about 10 euro to the centre of Madrid so not too bad and I understand the metro is close by as well. On checkout we were nearly charged for something which should have been included so it's worth checking the details just in case. We did enjoy exploring all the floors in the hotel and it was lovely but on balance I don't think it's worth the money. I think probably spoilt a little for me by the location.

Reviews.Title: “Overdesign”
Reviews.Author: chinique
Reviews.Content: Yes, the design is a very good reason for visiting this hotel. Fans of architecture have no other choice but to book here, plus there is Torres Blancas, the icon of Spanish brutalism two blocks away. Misfortunately as some reviewers already mentioned - the high-end in terms of aethetics comes with low-end (here and there) in terms of functionality - for example, our Zaha Hadid double room has 40cm wide wardrobe (sic!) and this is not the only example. In my opinion the service is good and very friendly plus the customer-facing staff have quite a good skill of English, which is a treasure here in Madrid. I would also recommend the ground floor restaurant Lagrimas Negras - very polite service and Chef with high ambitions. Av de América at which the hotel is situated is 6 to 9 lanes Madrid ringroad (count the lanes on a satellite map, it is so much fun) so Formula 1 fans shouldn't hesitate to book rooms at the lower floors, 24/365 traffic buzz guaranted. If you are a tourist - the location is not very good, either. You will need either additional 100EUR per day for taxis or additional 1h per day in metro, or just rent a car. Summarising - the hotel is quite okay, maybe for business trips, but for tourists value for money is below average, so if you are not New Russians like we are ;), think twice before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great!”
Reviews.Author: bojomania
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Madrid and spent the weekend at Puerta America. The rooms are very unique we've seen with so many "little" touches. The bathroom with overhead shower and super soaker tub is wonderful. The staff are extremely friendly and very helpful. We had a late check out and were not charged extra, this was well appreciated and they held our luggage while we did some last minute sightseeing before our late flight out. I would definitely stay here again. Although it's not in the center we actually preferred the location. My only point for improvement would be the cost of breakfast; it was 25 euro/person and in my opinion far too expensive and not worth the price. I think the hotel is being unreasonable by charging so much for breakfast, at most I would expect 10 euro/person.

Reviews.Title: “*Creator Paradise *”
Reviews.Author: Kdenci
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights and were impressed by the decor and comfort of our room. Queen sized bed was lovely (little too hard for me). Since each floor had been created by different designers, it was amazing to stop off at each floor to get a taste of what it might be like in suites on different floors! We stayed on the 11th floor, which was designed by Marisal and Salas. As requested, the hotel staff had organised a birthday cake and extras, and were efficient and welcoming in all areas. Room service was good, although did take longer than expected. The breakfast buffet was gorgous and healthy! The indoor pool was very calming and relaxing-with a fantastic steam room!!! A well presented hotel with warm and friendly staff! Would be great for those working or studying interior design, architecture and so on, or simply those who appreciate great ambience and decor. A short Metro ride into the heart of Madrid too... 100% recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel - great rooms”
Reviews.Author: mattrLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel in late June 2008. While the location lets the place down slightly, I really enjoyed my stay. Each level has been designed by a different prominent architect and they have really expressed themselves in the design so it is all pretty unconventional but makes for an interesting stay. We found the service to be good and the rooms (in addition to the interesting design) were perfectly clean and well appointed. On arrival you are able to choose (subject to availability) which of the floors you want to stay on - there are photos to help you make your choice. The only other gripe I have is that drinks etc., were totally over-priced and I could not really see why. In terms of the location, it is reasonably close to the airport but the area itself (while not being a bad area) is very dull and there is a busy road right outside the hotel. It is a shame this hotel is not in a more interesting area as that would really make it top notch. I would happily go back to experience this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic design!”
Reviews.Author: Kurosaki_Ichigo
Reviews.Content: The concept of the hotel was intriguing, although what made us go ahead to book a stay here was the price. At less than 200 euros per night, it was an excellent deal for a 5-star hotel. We stayed on the Plasma Studio floor, which was amazing. Weirdly-angled and shiny walls and floor dominated the lift lobby and corridor. The room was good, with the decor dominated by metallic finishes and glass. The only issue I had was that the walls in the bathroom were peeling and fell into the tub, rendering it unusable. Not the best of locations, but at least it wasn't too inconvenient as the hotel is near 2 metro stations (Cartegena and Avda di America).

Reviews.Title: “What a brilliant place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Veronlc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for a surprise break and the experience was brilliant. On arriving at the hotel we got to choose which floor we wanted to stay on, each floor is themed so it's worth checking out their website to see the different styles and designs each floor has to offer. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room itself was clean and of a high standard - the bed was extemely comfortable. The bar on the top floor was great for the scenic views in the evening. The lifts are a ride in themselves you have great views of Madrid as you travel up and down, stop off on every floor and have a nose around at the great designs of decor on each fllor you will be amazed!! The location is probably a bit out of the way but the metro is on your doorstep so please dont let this put you off booking this great hotel. The metro system was a good network too. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did - can't wait to go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury with a Quirk”
Reviews.Author: SKL_VA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Puerta America is a truly unique luxury hotel in Madrid. I stayed for business and thought the hotel was lovely and perfectly central for both work and tourist activities -- 15 min cab ride to/from the airport, 3 minute walk to the Metro station (loved the metro!) and/or a 10 min cab ride downtown. As you will read in other reviews of the hotel, each floor was designed by a different architect and has a completely unique layout and feel. My room was located on the second floor, designed by Norman Foster, in an ultra-modern white leather and stainless steel motif. (The walls were white, padded leather -- got quite a laugh about getting put in the padded room.) The hotel staff are all bilingual, so my very minimal Spanish was not a hindrance. The concierge desk was helpful planning tourist outings, assisting with travel arrangments and making dinner reservations. They recommended restaurants both within and outside the hotel and all were quite good, especially the MAD restaurant (in the hotel) and Chatflan, a 10 min cab ride away. Only two negatives: First, the breakfast buffet was wonderful, but at 35 euros per person ($52 USD) was terribly overpriced. Second, the hallway carpeting on my floor was badly stained and frayed; definitely out of place in such a high-quality hotel. All things considered, it was a wonderful, unique place to stay, and a great alternative to downtown hotels. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Shame about Location”
Reviews.Author: KentTraveller1
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, definitley a 5 star hotel. Each floor is individual as it has been designed by a different architect. We stayed on the Katherine Finlay floor (8th) which was very space age and all in white and very modern. Very trendy! If you're after a swanky hotel this is the place to stay. I have stayed in a few 5 star hotels but none have provide as much accessories as this, they provide a comb, toothbrush and toothpaste and even perfume! There is a small gym (treadmill, cross-trainner, rowing machine), small pool, lovely steam room and a couple of hot and cold experiences. Greatly appreciated after an exhausting day around Madrid. The only down side to it was the location as it was about 30mins on the metro to the centre of Madrid and involved a change of line, which after a few days can get exhausting. But the metro stop was about a 5 mins walk. I would definitley like to stay in one of these hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Some Amazing Rooms, Close to AIrport”
Reviews.Author: mahme
Reviews.Content: We had planned to stay at the Puerta America for a night after a 10 hour flight from Uruguay. We had booked for the Ron Arad floor, unfortunately, the hotel e-mailed us a week before to inform us that that floorm would be renovated. We then asked for the Plasma Studio floor. Our flight landed at 7am, we decided to show up at the hotel (even though check-in time is 14:00). The welcome was warm and the reception immediately gave us a room on the Plasma Studio (they also offered us to select any other floor if we wished..) The rooms in Plasma studio, are intesrting... But I do not recomend them to couples. The only dividion between the bathrrom and room is a glass wall, so that you have no privacy in the bathroom. The next evening, we decided to watch a PPV movie but the system was not working (around 10pm). I spoke to the reception who immediately proposed to switch us to new rooms. I asked for a different floor and they immediately (5-10 minutes) sent someone with our new keys and to help us with the luggage. We mov ed to the Richard Gluckman floor. The rooms were very nice (though less extreme). We did experience some trouble in trying to figure out how the shower worked. The room did not have a bathtub. Finally, one final comment regarding the food served in the restaurants. Boith rstaurants are excellent and I greatly recommend them. PS: On previous stays, I tried the Zaha Hadid floor (amazing: Hughe Bathtub!!!!!!!!! and very extreme design. - but small because of the curvy walls). and the Jean Nouvelle floor (only suites - very spacious, beautiful bathroom, and sliding panels dividing the rooms..)

Reviews.Title: “A very different experience”
Reviews.Author: henrieta
Reviews.Content: We were presented with a book of the individual floors in order to choose which floor was OK for us. We chose the 10th (Japanese) floor. Although the room was a bit too dark, it didn’t matter because the whole setting was just amazing. It’s not something I would like to have at home, but it was a great experience. The bathroom was very bright, with a wooden bath and a little window leading to the bedroom through which we had a great view over the city from the shower.
