The location is not good if you like to be in the city centre. But there is the Metro station a few minutes walk from the hotel and enough taxis which are very cheap. The staff at the reception were extremely helpful and professional. Everything went smoothly even though we didn’t book in advance. The only minus were the prices in the top floor bar and the staff there which are emotionless and working like the robots. Overall, the hotel was very impressive and definitely worth the visit even if you are not a fan of a modern style décor (just like us). If you go, don’t miss out on a walk over a glass floor behind the lifts on the 13th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous, impractical, magnificent.”
Reviews.Author: Scammers
Reviews.Content: I found staying at this hotel a fantastic experience. Yes, it is totally impractical but it is also quite stunning. No expense has been spared on the decor and I am sure that even a short break will remain long in the memory of anyone who stays here. The location is a bit out of the way but that is the only criticism I have. And I have to say I found the staff to be extremely obliging and attentive. A unique and unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern design but very bad service”
Reviews.Author: Roccox
Reviews.Content: The first impression I got when I arrived to this hotel was: a modern, abstract and sofisticated place, a place for artists, decorators, arquitects, etc, but then one day after I discovered it is not a good place for businessmen, families or old people. The rooms are nice and big, but not practical to work, my room was practically black too dark although I understand every room and every floor is different so you don't know what you may expect. The service practically everywhere was terrible, the staff don't have the attitude of service neither customer focus. Yes, every thing looks very modern and minimalistic creating an atmosphere very impersonal and cold. I had great expectations of this hotel, with its red and blue colors iliminating the modern building at night, but it was worthless.

Reviews.Title: “design hotel”
Reviews.Author: giantkatestacks
Reviews.Content: This hotel does fall into the trap of style over substance somewhat but the style is just about good enough to make up for it. Good things about the hotel: Requesting a particular floor before you go that fits in with your personal aesthetic. The view from, and the music in, the top floor bar. The food in the restaurant and cafe - though overpriced, it was really good. The hotel is close to the metro, though a few changes are required to get into the centre. Proximity to other architecturally interesting sites. Bad things about the hotel: Pool wasnt open. Slightly snooty staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: harepus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not like any other hotels. Make sure you stay at a floor that makes you comfortable though, not all floors are like that. My favourite are floor 7 if you are in love or single traveller and 6 if you share a room with just a friend. Location could be better though, a little bit far from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyashish
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Hotel Puerta America in Madrid. The hotel is quite nice - very different from any other hotel I've been to. The key to this hotel is that each floor is designed by a different designer so all the floors have unique looks. I stayed on the 7th floor - great bed and projector TV. Pros: Great design and clean hotel. 24hr room service. Good bar in the lobby. Good service. Cons: Area - not walking distance to anything special, so you have to take a taxi to go just about anywhere. I was here for business, so was basically in and out, but I'm not sure I would recommend this for leisure travelers as I'd want to be closer to a metro and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Designer magic”
Reviews.Author: bristolreviewer
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel and found it a very enjoyable if somewhat strange place to stay. Our room on the fourth floor was located amidst sculpture that would not have been out of place in Dr Who! The room was well equipped, though the open view bathroom would not suit everyone. Breakfasts were good with an excellent buffet. The roof bar is a great place for a late night drink, and the spa, though small, offers reasonable treatments. Bar prices are hefty for soft drinks but good value for spirits. The hotel is close to two metro stations and taxis are easy to come by. Staff were friendly and the hotel is an amazing experience of design and electronics, drippingly trendy. One thing to beware: some taxi drivers at the airport are crooks - you should pay around €15 to get here from the airport (not the €30 we were charged) - insist on a meter.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: devogel
Reviews.Content: Hello, we had four beautiful days in the hotel. Beautiful here means excellent design, superb designed rooms (change room every day!!!), great views, great bar and restaurant, breakfast very good. But if you're not interested in modern design hotels, don't go here. Beware that the hotel is worth a visit now (already open one year), but you see already some damage from its frequent use.
